story:
Short Summary

Typhoon Haiyan - the strongest typhoon ever recorded in history - hit the Philippines a few days ago. News reporters say that this typhoon makes hurricanes Sandy and Katrina look weak. With that being said, the aftermath is devastating. The death toll is a scary statistics for it increases day by day. However much we try, there is nothing we can do to take back the lives that have been lost. But there is something we can do to protect and preserve those that have been spared.

When I watch the news, I see survivors. They have demonstrated an unparalleled level of strength and resiliency. Yet they remain weary for they know fully well that their battle against disaster is far from over. They are hungry, thirsty and sick. These physical needs coupled with emotional struggles over trauma, loss, and grief seem unbearable. Unless...

"Unless someone like you cared a whole awful lot, nothing is going to get better. It's not." ~ Dr. Seuss

My name is Rio Cornell Dy Golo. I was born and raised in the Philippines. My hometown, Maasin City, is a mere 3-hour drive south from Tacloban City. Under different circumstances, the survivors - or worse, the corpses - on TV could have included me or my family. Tragedy, in all honesty, could happen to anybody. But we've been blessed. Let us be a blessing to others too.

What We Need & What You Get

The typhoon victims need our help. They need food and water the most. This campaign is focused on their most immediate needs. Full recovery from the storm is a long and continuous process. But right now, I just want to help survivors thrive. I would be devastated if the survivors got away with Haiyan but gave in to starvation. Because this is preventable. And we can all help. 

The money I get from this campaign will be used to buy relief goods - primarily, food and water - which will be personally distributed through the help of people I know and trust back home. 

Every penny counts. As little as 7.50 USD can feed a family of four in one day - that's three full meals. 

The Impact

Your spare change is somebody's bread and butter. Your contribution can literally save people's lives. It will help quench their thirst and satisfy their hunger. And I believe that there is no better feeling than in knowing you have given somebody somewhere a reason to smile once more.

Aside from the satisfaction that comes with giving, you will also get my perpetual gratitude for your kindness and compassion. In behalf of my fellow Filipinos, thank you! May God bless you a thousandfold.

Other Ways You Can Help

It's a hard life and money is a big issue for a lot of us. If you can't make a contribution right now, I understand. But there are other ways to help. Spread the word. Maybe someone you know will be willing to make a contribution. Or simply put your palms together, close your eyes, and say a little prayer.

And that’s all there is to it. Thank you!

story:
Hi Everyone!

I am a Junior at The Ohio State University, and I want to attend medical school when I graduate.  I am riding 180 miles in Pelotonia, a grassroots bike ride with ONE GOAL: END CANCER. We all know someone who has been affected by this horrible disease, and more often than not it hits too close to home.

Currently, funding for research from the government (NIH) is flat if not declining, and to cure diseases like cancer, we need research dollars.  If we can no longer get it from the government, we should go out and raise it ourselves, which is exactly what Pelotonia is about.

The Ohio State University Comprehensive Cancer Center: Jamees Cancer Hospital and Solove Research Institute at OSU is the Midwest's first and Ohio's only fully dedicated cancer hospital and research institute, and a premier hospital for the prevention, detection, and treatment of cancer.

We can cure cancer, but that requires, which demands funding. By supporting my ride, you will be directly helping the doctors at The James devise novel therapies through the purchase of groudbreaking equipment and recruitment of the best doctors in the nation.

 

Thank you for your time and your support. Together we can end cancer.

story:
Camp SEXY is a Rochester, NY based theme camp (with a large number in our NYC contingent!) who have been coming to the mid-atlantic regaional Burning Man event Playa del Fuego (PDF) since 2006. Originally a couple of pop-ups and the Buns and Dogs event, we have grown to over 25 members, a Sexy lounge, a dance camp (unintentionally), numerous events including Bunny Lounge, Burlague, Mis-fortune, Grog with Greg, Acoustic Jam and Bread, and of course, Camp Sexy has been your Naked Slip and Slide Sexy Synchronized Swim Team since 2010!

En route to Spring PDF 2012, our trailer - the primary means of transporting camp infrastructure the 7 hours from Upstate NY to Delaware - finally bit the dust. After a recent (costly) investment in both a sound system and generator to bring our Sexy brand of music and performance to you, we find ourselves unable to raise the $1000 - $1200 for a replacement trailer on our own. We do realize we can rent one, but given our long term commitment to PDF (some of us have been coming for 10 years), it seems like a good investment in our camp's future. Any and all money will go towards the purchase of a trailer; anything additional will be used for updating additional camp infrustructure.

While we're not totally thrilled to be asking the community for help, we figured it couldn't hurt to try. So if you love the Sexy Lounge, if you love Camp SEXY, and you want to see us out in full force this fall (and many years to come!), consider becoming one of our Sexy backers!

story:
Dying For A Kidney

This is a campaign for Debbie Barr, and she was born with only one kidney. In September 2011 after a lifetime of struggling with continued illnesses, including over 30+ surgeries, that kidney failed. She is currently on dialysis 3 times per week, 4 hours a session. While she has completed all of the testing required to be placed on the kidney transplant list, they are now requiring her to have an account set up with the funds set aside to pay for the expensive anti-rejection medications that will be required after the transplant.

This is the last step to help this 50 year young wife, mother and grandmother get onto the list to receive a life saving kidney. Please contribute and help her achieve this goal.

What We Need

To get the needed approval to be placed on the transplant list, Debbie is required to have an account set up with $3000-$4000 in it to start. It is set aside to pay for the required anti-rejection medications that she will have to take daily for the rest of her life. 100% of the funds that are raised will go towards this medications account goal and move Debbie closer to her goal of getting off of dialysis, and receive a life saving kidney transplant.

Can’t Contribute? There Are Other Ways You Can Help

Obviously not every one of you can make a monetary contribution, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help Debbie achieve her goal and be a part of her getting her life saving kidney. Help Spread The Word!! Tell all of your friends about this fundraising event. Post to your Facebook page! Send a Tweet! Send everyone in your email address book the link to this page.

Thank you for your time and any contribution you can make!

story:
This message is to save my son.

In August, 2009 Casey Strale entered a team into an Ironman tournament.  For those unfamiliar with the concept, an Ironman requires a roller hockey team to play with no subs, the same players on the floor for the entire game. To say it’s a game for those with extreme stamina is an understatement.  Casey Strale was known around the Irvine facility ‘The Rinks’ as a player with that required stamina.  Most of all he was known for his passion for the sport of hockey.  It was his favorite thing to do and you could often find him honing his game at all hours of the day.  His work ethic was magnetic: “He is the first one at the rink and his love of hockey is what makes everyone love him,” said his coach Dave Cairns.

It was at this Ironman tournament that Casey began to feel more winded than before.  His usual reserve of stamina was wearing out and he found himself worn out by the end of games.   Casey headed to see a doctor for an ultrasound on Tuesday, September 22, 2009 and what he was told was nothing short of serious.  Casey had Cancer.  His casual Tuesday visit to doctor led to surgery that following Friday.  A grapefruit sized tumor had grown on his left kidney.  In surgery, the diagnoses was grave; his prognosis, Adrenal Cortical Carcinoma, we were given a 15% chance of survival. Then Casey obtained the the title of "The Miracle Boy" being one of the only patients at the Children’s Hospital of Orange County to ever be on life support and survive coming off of it.  The same resolve that Casey displayed on the rink against the opposition was now going to battle against the toughest opponent that he ever laced up against.

At the present Casey has indured multiple surgeries, drug regimens and clinical trials, continues to battle his cancer and play hockey when his stregnth allows.  The last MRI showing new bylateral tumors now in his lungs. We continue to research to find new drugs and new ways to save our son.  He continues his treatment, meanwhile his doctors have continued to give their blessing to be able to play hockey. The same passion that he displays competing in every shift helps him in his everyday battle.  Sometimes winning Gold isn’t the worst thing in the world.  For Casey Strale his gold medal was just getting the chance to play.

You can see Casey's complete journey on his CaringBridge website:www.caringbridge.org/visit/caseystrale

Casey and I will be traveling to Santa Rosa, California in January for DCA, dichloroacetate therapy. This procedure is not covered by insurance.  Angel flights will be helping us get there but we need some additional assistance with therapy and lodging if possible.
We will be visiting dr. Eliaz at Amitabha Clinic.  His information and more information on DCA is provided on the links below.
Dr. Isaac Eliaz
http://www.amitabhaclinic.com/#!about-the-clinic
DCA
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tkDIPbAU_nk&feature=youtube_gdata_player

 

We hope to not only extend Casey's life but find a cure for him and others like him.

We know not everyone can give financially but you can use the share buttons and pass on our information, anything will help.

This message is to save my son.
In August, 2009 Casey Strale entered a team into an Ironman tournament.  For those unfamiliar with the concept, an Ironman requires a roller hockey team to play with no subs, the same players on the floor for the entire game. To say it’s a game for those with extreme stamina is an understatement.  Casey Strale was known around the Irvine facility ‘The Rinks’ as a player with that required stamina.  Most of all he was known for his passion for the sport of hockey.  It was his favorite thing to do and you could often find him honing his game at all hours of the day.  His work ethic was magnetic: “He is the first one at the rink and his love of hockey is what makes everyone love him,” said his coach Dave Cairns.
It was at this Ironman tournament that Casey began to feel more winded than before.  His usual reserve of stamina was wearing out and he found himself worn out by the end of games.   Casey headed to see a doctor for an ultrasound on Tuesday, September 22, 2009 and what he was told was nothing short of serious.  Casey had Cancer.  His casual Tuesday visit to doctor led to surgery that following Friday.  A grapefruit sized tumor had grown on his left kidney.  In surgery, the diagnoses was grave; his prognosis, Adrenal Cortical Carcinoma, we were given a 15% chance of survival. Then Casey obtained the the title of "The Miracle Boy" being one of the only patients at the Children’s Hospital of Orange County to ever be on life support and survive coming off of it.  The same resolve that Casey displayed on the rink against the opposition was now going to battle against the toughest opponent that he ever laced up against.
At the present Casey has indured multiple surgeries, drug regimens and clinical trials, continues to battle his cancer and play hockey when his stregnth allows.  The last MRI showing new bylateral tumors now in his lungs. We continue to research to find new drugs and new ways to save our son.  He continues his treatment, meanwhile his doctors have continued to give their blessing to be able to play hockey. The same passion that he displays competing in every shift helps him in his everyday battle.  Sometimes winning Gold isn’t the worst thing in the world.  For Casey Strale his gold medal was just getting the chance to play.
You can see Casey's complete journey on his CaringBridge website:www.caringbridge.org/visit/caseystrale


Casey and I will be traveling to Santa Rosa, California in January for DCA, dichloroacetate therapy. This procedure is not covered by insurance.  Angel flights will be helping us get there but we need some additional assistance with therapy and lodging if possible.
We will be visiting dr. Eliaz at Amitabha Clinic.  His information and more information on DCA is provided on the links below.
Dr. Isaac Eliaz
http://www.amitabhaclinic.com/#!about-the-clinic
DCAhttp://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tkDIPbAU_nk&feature=youtube_gdata_player



 
We hope to not only extend Casey's life but find a cure for him and others like him.


We know not everyone can give financially but you can use the share buttons and pass on our information, anything will help.

story:
HELP SAVE THE SCHEYDEN CATALINA AIR SHOW!

Created for the citizens of Catalina Island and Long Beach and produced by a small volunteer committee;  the Catalina Air Show is modelled and already well on its way to becoming a truly World Class event.

With additional community events planned to coincide with the show, and potential involvement with local schools, charities, social groups; the negative impact of losing such a proven community building event - is tragic on several levels. 

Performers have already agreed to attend without cost to the show - but community support is needed to assure that the show will happen this year, and have the necessary nest egg to begin planning for next year.

SMALLER CONTRIBUTIONS ARE APPRECIATED AS WELL

Super Dave Mathieson and several other performers have now offered their aircraft to provide thrilling rides for supporters of the show.    As a result - challenges have been issued to local and regional businesses, organizations and groups.  By collecting donations internally or from customers, holding raffles, and silent auctions.  Anyone can help out their local communities by contributing as a group.  

If you'd like to donate and re-gift the "Ride of Your Life" back to a local youth or other deserving individual - please feel free to contact us directly - so we can make sure we can accommodate you.

All additional challenges are welcome, and any person, group, business or organization which contributes the $1500.00 minimum donation(s) will be **entitled to name the lucky individual(s) who will take the ride(s). 

Any contribution which qualifies for the "Ride of Your Life" will be eligible but the ride must take place within 1 hour flying distance of Los Angeles and be conducted on or before October 27th 2013.  

We are likewise happy to choose a local group or cause to accept your "Ride of A Lifetime" on your behalf.

(**Location, Health and size restrictions will apply based on the aircraft available and location)

story:
At Fresh Picks, we aim to make fresh, healthy food affordable and accessible to everyday office workers.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

UPDATE #1 ($2,500 milestone achieved!)

Thank you, everyone, for your unbelievable support!  We never thought we would get this far, but we have -- thanks to YOU!  The $2,500 we've raised so far has been enough to fund our initial inventory and cover costs we've incurred at the beginning of the project (permits, website, etc.).

We have just started our pilot and are now ready to ROLL (see our production line of wraps below? har har) and serve our lunches to our first customer!!  

But we still have a long way to go and need to raise a little more money to pay for the rental of our kitchen and delivery truck, as well as pay for some professional consultation fees.  So please continue to support us by telling all your family and friends about our campaign.

11 days to go, $6,800 to raise -- we can do this, team! 

 

My Story

I used to work in an office where food options were very limited.  Our cafeteria served food that wasn’t that great, and we usually had to drive to get food outside.  So I started packing my own lunch to work every day.  I would bring my own salad and develop my own salad dressings.  

My colleagues became so jealous of my salads that some of my closest friends asked me to pack an extra one for them and they’d pay me for the trouble.  Before I knew it, word got around and what used to be two extra salads a day became a small production line of twenty salads made fresh every morning.

Fresh Picks Production Line (Producing out of my own kitchen in 2011)

When I found myself waking up at 6am every day to pack salads for my colleagues, I knew I discovered something I was passionate about.  I would rarely wake up at 6am for work.  

And when my sales continued to grow, I knew I was on to something.  There was a market that was literally hungry for fresh, healthy food that was easily accessible to them.

 

Fresh Picks Salads (A mini-pilot in 2012)

Since then, we’ve been working tirelessly on putting together a business plan to scale this business. 

We've partnered with a chef...

 

Developed a menu...

 

 

 

Found a commercial kitchen to work in...

Secured our first client...

Locked down our delivery system...

And are continuously working on putting together all the other logistical items in place before the pilot.

 

What we need & what you get

After a year's worth of hard work, we’ve finally reached an exciting turning point!  We are gearing up for a small scale pilot of Fresh Picks in mid-November to ensure that we are able to perfect our supply chain prior to a large scale launch, and I need YOUR help to make it happen.

Because we are running a small-scale version of our operations and will not achieve economies of scale, we are hoping to raise enough contributions to fund these costs through this Indiegogo campaign.

You can help in multiple ways. No matter how big or small your contribution is, you can still make a lasting impact!


The Impact

Your gift will help us on so many levels.  First, it will be a vote of confidence for our business idea and our vision.  Second, it will allow us to run a small-scale pilot of our business.  Lastly, you will help make fresh, healthy lunches one step closer to becoming available to your offices one day.

 

Thank you.

Minnie Fong

Founder & CEO

www.freshpicksmeals.com

info@freshpicksmeals.com

story:
I have known Kenley for several years now. She has THE fiercest personality ever, it would make Tyra Banks jealous. About a year ago, she found the love of her life, a US Soldier. As a fellow military wife myself, I know how difficult military relationships can be at times. But her husband Perry is her strongest support. He has never left her side. Neither have her friends, her real friends. When you find out you have cancer at the age of 24, you learn who your real friends are. 

The last 2 years Kenley has battled 7 different types of Cancer. She first learned she had cancer 8 years ago and battled against Leukemia and won. Her mother passed away in 2010 from Breast Cancer. She has been in and out of the ER, gone through countless weeks of chemo, a bone marrow transplant, and very sadly, lost their first baby in the second trimester. You name it. SEriously...just about anything and everything. I've never met such a fighter like her. She is almost always in high spirits being her crazy fun self. She is the one that inspires us. She'e been to hell and back, yet she's the one setting everything else on fire in her path that may get in her way. I've seriously never met a person with such perseverance as this woman. Her friend Dana has started this fundraising idea. I decided to help her spread the word. Kenley has done so much for Dana, as she has for all of us, we decided to do something for her now. 

In May, my aunt passed away from Ovarian Cancer. Its almost undetectable until it's in it's fatal stages. I was so incredibly close to her and it breaks my heart to think about how it took her life and I refuse to sit by and let this stupid disease get to my friend, or any other person for that matter. As you can see, Kenley's go-get-em attitude has rubbed off on all of us. :)

After spreading a link of a Scentsy party to raise money originally, more people were asking me about just making a donation straight to her, rather than purchasing a product to make sure she gets 100% of their donation. One of my friend's told me about this site, so here we are.

100% of your donation will go to Kenley and Perry to help them pay medical bills. Yes, they have military health care but that doesn't cover costs like this with all they go through. On the 25th of September Kenley underwent a 16 hour brain surgery to have a recurring tumor removed, as well as more cancer in her jaw, esophagus, knee, spine, colon, cervix and stomach. This is one of the biggest surgeries she's had lately and she needs all the support she can get. She is not the type of person to ask for help at all. All she wants is a lot of junk food! :) She's never once complained and said "Poor me." Never. I don't know if I could be that strong, but this girl, she is Superwoman. 

UPATE: 10/3: Today Kenley is having another surgery to remove the rest of the brain tumor that they couldn't remove during the massive surgery she had last week. After this, she will start on about 34 weeks of a new kind of chemo. They need every bit of support they can get right now.

Our goal is $1000 right now. If we hit it, or go over that would be AMAZING, the more for them, the less burden they will have. Anything and everything will help! No amount is too small! So if you can, we would be forever grateful for anything you donate to help her and her hubby and make the burden of bills a bit easier to bear. 

I understand not everyone can contribute. If you can't, thoughts and prayers are welcome as always by all. Research cancer, and maybe do a Cancer run to raise awareness in your community, instead of posting a Facebook status on the color of your bra or where you hide your purse.  Thank you all so much for your time, donation and prayers. We will continue to keep everyone updated!

We will continue to keep everyone updated!

story:
Hi there. My name is Colin Davis. I'm raising money for my cross-Canada bicycle trip titled: Ride East. Don't Die. It's a 7500km journey from Mile Zero of the TransCanada Highway in Victoria BC, to the most eastern point of North America, Cape Spear. Which is just outisde of St. John's, Newfoundland. Why? Because I need to prove to myself that I can overcome any challenge if I set my mind to it.  Riding from one coast to another across the second largest country in the world in two months is a pretty big challenge, so if I can do this, I know I can do anything. 

And a bigger resaon? I want to raise money and awareness for prostate cancer research.  My grandfather died from prostate cancer when I was young, and it left a pretty big hole. So it's a cause that's important to me.  And more than that, it's the most common form of cancer in Canadian men, if you exclude non-melanoma skin cancers. 1 in 7 men will be diagnosed with prostate cancer and 1 in 28 will die from it, according to the Canadian Cancer Society.   So this isn't just a personal journey, it's also about raising awareness about prostate cancer, and to hopefully raise money to donate towards research.

But I need your help.  As you might imagine it's not cheap to do this. For one thing, there is a lot of gear that I need to buy in order to be able to survive on the road and stay in good physical shape. Then there's the issue of eating enough to stay healthy, as well as travelling to my start point in the first place. 

So how much do I need? A pretty rough estimate would be between $2500, and $3000. It's hard to know exactly since I have never done this before and I can't say for certain how long it will take me, or how much I'll need to spend while I'm on the road. The only sure expenses right now are the things I need to buy just to be able to do this, and right now it looks like it'll be $1500 for all the gear. Some of which I have already bought. I'll get more into detail in a post on the trip journal page. 

So here's what I'm asking: Any support you can give me, in any shape or amount, to help make this trip possible.  It could be financial support, or it could just be as simple as telling someone you know about it and getting them interested. Every little bit will help. 

I don't want this trip to bankrupt me but I don't want to make any money off of it either. All money that I raise above what I need to complete this journey will be donated to charity. 


Can't donate? That's cool! Why not share this campaign on your social media networks and encourage your friends and family to donate instead? 


For more information and to follow along with the journey, check out my website: colindaviddavis.com

story:
Starting Up a New Wheelchair Rugby Team

The Fighting Gray Squirrels Wheelchair Rugby organization is a non-profit sports organization that offers people with physical disabilities and wheelchair rugby enthusiasts a home to play, compete and become socially involved within the sports community. This will assist in reducing social isolation, increasing community connectivity and improving mental health, a well-documented issue affecting those with spinal cord injuries

Funding Amount Requested: $8000.00
Funds raised will be directly invested in the start up our therapy wheelchair rugby organization including the care and wellness of our quadriplegic participants, specialty sport wheelchairs, providing player sponsorships and maintaining our facility rental.

The Fighting Squirrels Wheelchair Rugby Organization is a therapeutic service for people with quadriplegic disabilities in the Halton Region for a source of recreation and sports. We are dedicated to enhancing the quality of life for young and adults with various physical, acquired and developmental disabilities.

The relationship between mental health and recreation is well documented. Recreation can assist with alleviating the symptoms of depression and anxiety,(Stathopoulou, Powers, Berry, Smits & Otto, 2006) in both clinical populations and non clinical populations. What is lesser known is the relationship between people with spinal cord injuries and mental health. The incidence of mental health issues in people with spinal cord injuries is reported to be double that of the general population, with mental health issues affecting almost half of those injured (Migliorini, Tonge & Taleporos, 2007) At this time there are no sports organizations for quadriplegics in the Halton community. Athletes are currently travelling as far as London or Toronto to take part in recreational activity. Quadriplegics in Halton have limited access to sports/recreational services, denying them the opportunity to improve their mental health through recreation.

The Fighting Squirrels will provide a local therapeutic wheelchair rugby team for disabled athletes to be part of. Everyone is included men, women, young and old. The team will increase social connectedness by fostering a team spirit where attitude is more important than aptitude. It will also provide an opportunity for quadriplegics to alleviate mental health symptoms through recreation, teamwork and healthy competition.

One way we will measure the project will be by having eight to ten athletes participate with the Fighting Squirrels organization. The second way we measure the success of the project will be by the player’s physical and mental state. If the disabled athletes are in a better physical and mental state the organization is a success. Physical tests like endurance, strength and co-ordination will be tested quarterly. Mental state is harder to test. We will look to see if the player’s report that their mood has elevated since joining the organization. Mental happiness consists of emotional response, satisfaction and general judgment about life.

We need to ensure that people with a disability have as much opportunity and choice to participate in sports regardless of where they live. Our involvement in the many issues surrounding mental health is based on our fundamental principles of participation in decision-making, citizenship and inclusion in community life. Therapeutic athletic activities with peer and family support promotes socialization, develops leadership skills, focus and physical fitness. People with various physical, acquired and developmental disabilities can experience mental illnesses like depression. Sometimes it can be difficult for us to understand how challenging it is for people with disabilities because we look at their problems through our eyes. The pressures of rehabilitation and feelings of acceptance by others can be very hard for some. It’s important that we remind ourselves that while their problems may seem unimportant to us, they can feel overwhelming to young and adults with a disability. It’s important to take depression in those with disabilities seriously.

We hope you can help us out and reach our goal. Anything would help large or small.

Thank you.

promotes socialization, develops leadership skills, focus and physical 
fitness. People with various physical, acquired and developmental 
disabilities can experience mental illnesses like depression. Sometimes 
it can be difficult for us to understand how challenging it is for 
people with disabilities because we look at their problems through our 
eyes. The pressures of rehabilitation and feelings of acceptance by 
others can be very hard for some. It’s important that we remind 
ourselves that while their problems may seem unimportant to us, they can
 feel overwhelming to young and adults with a disability. It’s important
 to take depression in those with disabilities seriously.We hope you can help us out and reach our goal. Anything would help large or small.Thank you.

story: Good day everyone. I have been unemployed for some time and unfortunately a hair cut is just not in the budget. So I am humbly submitting this internet appeal for your financial aid...any amount will be greatly appreciated and 100 percent will be going towards new haircuts for a year. Should I receive this cut of hair, my friends will likely no longer make fun of me at social gatherings and parties. So fucking just do it and stop being an asshole. Also SamCrow has been making fun of me and shitting on my face relentlessly, so at the very least we can all get together and throw a penny in the hat to end that debauchery. Thanks to all.

story:
Short Summary

Andrew was diagnosed in September with late stage Neuroendocratic Cancer in his Pancreas and Liver. He is only 31 years old. This devastating blow came at a point in Andrew's life in which he has so many things to be proud of. He moved to New Mexico to be near his dad last year. He was working multiple jobs, just met the love of his life and was loving the outdoors and the mountains that he now called home. After his diagnosis Andrew is deteriorating rapidly. He has lost a massive amount of weight, he now weighs less than he did in the 7th grade. He can't eat, quite literally. He has no energy. He can't go out and enjoy his mountains and worst of all he can't work. 

Andrew went to the ER with bad stomach pain in September. This is where he was diagnosed. That day he was moved from Taos to Santa Fe where he spent time in the hospital undergoing tests. Upon his release he had to move back in with his dad, his money was gone, he could not work and he could not keep his apartment. His dad also drained his savings to help Andrew, hotel rooms, medicine, time off work they all take a toll and there was no way anyone could see this coming on someone so young.

Andrew has been living with his dad while getting worse and worse. Today, November 2nd, Andrew was readmitted to the hospital in Santa Fe. He has to remain on an IV as his body is completely rejecting food. The cancer in his Liver cobvers over 60% of his Liver. The doctors believe that with VERY agressive treatment they can give him a long life, however they must start now. We are not sure how long Andrew will remain in the hospital this time. The hospital is 2 hours from his home, which means more hotel rooms. His mom, siter and one of his brothers live in Florida, which means more plane flights, more hotels, more rental cars and more time off work. No one could plan for that. I am his oldest brother, I live in Dallas and have not been able to get out to see him yet. 

Andrew is a fighter. His family is heartbroken. He has no insurance, no job, no home. He needs our help. A dollar will help.

The state of New Mexico is helping, the drug companies are helping. We are not fighting this completely alone, but there is more that is needed.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need at least $5,000. These funds will help to pay for his monthly medication and other expenses related to his illness. You will get only satisfaction out of helping Andrew. I wish we could give you more but every available resource my family has is going into this.

 

Please consider donating to our cause, literally any amount helps. Whether you donate or not, PLEASE spread the news. Email this link to everyone in your adress book. Post it on your facebook page. Yell the link from a mountain top! I don't want to let something as trivial as money cost me my brother!

story:
My Name is Thomas Meyer, my daughter Ashley was diagnosed with Hodgkin's Lymphoma in July 2012. 

    At the time of the scans the scans revealed many tumors throughout her torso,  1 was 14cm long by 5 cm wide.  She actually had more cancer than body at that point.  Her insurance has a large deductable/out of pocket expense that we are tryting to help her raise as well as other expenses related to her struggle.  Ashley is currently enrolled in the University of Wisconsin Whitewater where she is studying business and management, I want her to focus on her education and getting well throughout this period in her life.

     Breakdown of needs

    The funds we are requesting (10,000+) will go mostly towards he mounting medical expenses that insurance considers "Not Covered".  Other expenses would include gasoline/routine maintence of her vehicle for the numorous doctor visits, as many as 4-5 visits a day not all in the same location.  Overall she travels as much as 75-125 miles a day depending on what treatment she requires for that particular day.  We currently have a trust set up for her, so all funds go directly to that for proper dispursement.

    As we all know education is highly important to success in life, by taking the financial burden off her shoulders it frees her up to concentrate on her education, her long road to a full cancer free recovery and overall free state of mind/well being.

    All funds will go directly to Ashley's trust account and if we do not reach our goal any monies raised will go to the most needed areas of her expenses. 

The Impact

     We did have an amazing fund raiser for her in late October 2012 and managed to raise enough money for most of her medical expenses.  However that starts all over as of January 2013 as her "calander year" starts over then.

     Seeing her expression as we had the overwhelming support of our community, friends and family was worth more than any money we raised because it was the first time since this all started that Ashley realized she was not alone through any of her strugles.  As a father it also humbled me to fell the supoport and generosity of people even in trying times like the ones we all experience in our own lives. 

    Any donation made through out this campaign will help not only make a difference in Ashley's fight of this disease but also help her stay focused on her future.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

    Not everyone can donate and those who can't might help us spread the word about our benefit and bring potential contributors to our campaign. please use the share tools on the Indiegogo site also.

Canadian “Men’s Centre” Soon a Reality as Fundraising Nears Goal

Join the conversation on social media:

Get the word out using Indiegogo promotional tools

Volunteer with the Canadian Association for Equality

   

In addition to our Indiegogo campaign, CAFE has setup a special Founder’s Club program. Spearheaded by an anonymous leading supporter who donated $5,000, the Founder’s Club has been created to provide a special program of recognition, access and engagement for supporters who each contribute a matching donation of $5,000. Click here to learn about the unique benefits of the Founder’s Club.

story:
Why This Campaign?

Hey everyone! My name is Lauren Beller, and I live in Philadelphia. I went to Temple (GO OWLS!), and I have a degree in Elementary and Special Education. I am an activist, advocate, musician, movie-lover, and an overall good person.  I also happen to use a power wheelchair, and my current one is about to die.  My wheelchair is cool, but it costs a lot of money initially and also to maintain, but it also allows me to live my life mostly independently. I have a lot to offer this world despite my disability, and  my wheelchair is the main tool that allows me to be a part of society.

My current wheelchair is on its way out, which means that I am at risk of getting stranded in my home, or worse, it could stop working when I'm out in public.  My chair has several seating components that let me change the position I am sitting in, which decreases my chronic pain, but the motors for these systems are just about shot.  Long story short, I need a new chair.  The process has already begun, and my insurance company has covered the chair, but only about a third of the cost.  In order to get the chair, I owe $17,823.83 out of pocket.  This cost covers the portion of the chair that the insurance covered, but also the parts that were denied coverage. As you can see, I'm kind of stuck.

Can you please help? Every penny helps me.

What I Need

Here's the breakdown: 

  • Total for the chair (including parts that were covered and denied): $26,511.53
  • Amount covered by insurance: $8,687.70 
  • Denied items: $4,007.00
  • Total amount I owe: $17,823.83

I cannot offer much in the perks department, but please know that your generous contribution, however large or small, means so much to me. Any contribution you make will go directly to making me feel fully human by diminishing my chronic pain and by increasing my level of personal independence.

Any additional funds over my goal will be set aside for use to maintain the wheelchair or for other denied medical costs. 

The Impact

This new wheelchair will drastically impact the value of my life by doing the following:

  • Most obviously, it will allow me to navigate the world. The model of chair that I ordered is designed to navigate bumps while still maintaining its stability. It has several features that are designed to support someone of my weight that my current wheelchair does not have. 
  • I was born with a condition called Arthrogryposis, and it affects my joints, muscles, and ligaments. I have muscle weakness, stiffness, and a lot of pain. This wheelchair has elevating leg rests, the ability to tilt in space, can recline to a laying position, and has a seat elevator that allows me to increase my seated height by eight inches. The components that allow me to change my seating position are the difference between a life of pain and one where my pain is manageable. The seat elevator will help to compensate for my weaker muscles by allowing me additional access to higher items that would otherwise be out of my reach, or too heavy to lift from that height. 
  • I live in the city, and my social life is also enhanced by my wheelchair. People who don't use chairs often take for granted the privilege of being able to look a peer in the eyes. The seat elevator will allow me to do that as well. Another way my social life will be enhanced is through the longer battery life that the new chair has. 
  • This chair also has some safety features that are really important. It has a lights package on it, which will make it safer for me to navigate the city at night. This is something I have to do regularly, and safety has always been a concern. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I really appreciate you taking the time to read my story, and if you are in a position to contribute, I will be ever grateful. If you can't though, you can still help. Please share this link through your networks and use the Indiegogo sharing tools. 

Please help me fund this wheelchair so my disability can't hold me back.

Please help me fund this wheelchair so my disability can't hold me back.

story:
I’m Ryan C. Greene, CEO of GreeneHouse Media, Best Selling Author and National Radio Talk Show Host, but the one title that means the most to me is “DAD”! As a father of two young children it pains me to watch so many children literally having their lives stripped away from them by obesity! Whether it’s because of poor diet, lack of any form of exercise or misinformation, the trend of overweight kids in America must be bucked. The burden was laid on my heart to be an active warrior in the fight against childhood obesity and to help more kids find healthy lifestyle alternatives to what they’re currently being taught. I’ve incorporated the help of my own two children and we are setting out to revolutionize children’s health and fight childhood obesity one kid at a time!


THE PROBLEM


Childhood Obesity is an EPIDEMIC in America. The Center for Disease Control and Prevention’s states:

·  Childhood obesity has more than doubled in children and tripled in adolescents in the past 30 years.

·  The percentage of children aged 6–11 years in the United States who were obese increased from 7% in 1980 to nearly 18% in 2010. Similarly, the percentage of adolescents aged 12–19 years who were obese increased from 5% to 18% over the same period.

·  In 2010, more than one third of children and adolescents were overweight or obese.

Childhood obesity has both immediate and long term effects on health and well being. Some immediate health effects include: risk factors for cardiovascular disease such as high cholesterol and high blood pressure, pre-diabetes and greater risk for bone and joint problems, sleep apnea and social and psychological problems such as stigmatization and poor self-esteem. Long term health effects include: likelihood to be obese as adultsand are therefore more at risk for adult health problems such as heart disease, type 2 diabetes, stroke, several types of cancer, and osteoarthritis.


WHAT WE’RE GONNA DO ABOUT IT

’s Coach Greene’s KIDsanity!: In-Home Fitness Training System will only be the BIGGEST, MOST EXCITING, MOST ENTERTAINING, MOST INNOVATIVE solution to fight against childhood obesity this side of EVER!  A multi-disc DVD training system designed FOR KIDS and LED BY KIDS; KIDsanity! is not about getting skinny or becoming muscular, but this DVD system promotes physical fitness, healthy eating and healthy living for kids in a fun exciting way. Kids who embark on this 60-day fitness plan will get fit, learn better eating habits, become more physically and mentally healthy and successfully combat childhood obesity.

Your contribution to this campaign will make the filming and release of Coach Greene’s KIDsanity! possible thereby helping to combat childhood obesity and develop a healthier generation of youth. Your donation to make Coach Greene’s KIDsanity! a reality will literally SAVE CHILDREN from a lifetime of health, mental and financial problems relating to obesity.


THE PROBLEM SOLVERS

GreeneHouse Media has been providing “Media That Matters” since 2005. Founded and run by Ryan C. Greene (that’s me), GreeneHouse started as a book publishing company and has published 15 book titles reaching over 30 Amazon Best Sellers Lists. GreeneHouse is now transitioning into video and Coach Greene’s KIDSanity! is its first offering. I am a professional speaker and media personality. I have authored 5 self-help books, hosted national radio and TV shows and have a heart for helping young people. I am the proud father of Jordan and Jayden and am from Baltimore, MD.

GreeneHouse has assembled an All Star Team of experts to help make this project a success!

Coach Kena Hodges: Certified Zumba Instructor- will lead the Dance Workout workouts.


Coach Opel Jones: First Degree Black Belt, Karate- will lead the Martial Arts Workout workouts.


Coach Jamaal Piper: Certified Physical Trainer- will lead the Strength & Conditioning workouts.


Renee Carr, PhD.: Clinical Psychologist- will discuss with parents the mental benefits of fighting obesity.


Maia Jackson, MD.: Licensed Pediatrician- will discuss with parents the health benefits of fighting obesity.


Jordan & Jayden: The 11 and 9 year old brother and sister workout leaders for each DVD.


WHAT WE NEED TO MAKE THIS HAPPEN

Every single dollar helps! No contribution is too small. If you see value in this project, we urge you to give as much as you can, as soon as you can- then spread the word and encourage others to follow suit! We only have 30 DAYS to raise $15,000 to fully fund our project. If you want to give, give today!

Our fundraising goal is $15,000. That money will cover: film equipment rental, film crew, photography and catering for filming for five days ($7,500), editing and post-production ($1,000), trademark fees ($1,000), logo design ($300), packaging design ($200), DVD pressing/packaging ($4,000), rewards for funders ($400), print-marketing collateral ($200) and website design ($400). If we surpass our goal of $15,000 all additional funds will go towards: pressing more DVDs, recording radio promos, registering & travel for trade shows, shooting a 2-minute infomercial. We chose to go with Indiegogo because in the unfortunate circumstance that we do not reach our full goal we still can use all donations! If we do not reach our full minimum goal of $15,000 every dollar will be put into filming the actual workout DVDs. 


WHAT YOU GET FOR DONATING

Because your support is so valued, we have some great perks as a “Thank you” for your support.

$10  Thank You Video- Personalized "thank you" video emailed to you.

$25  Signed Poster Of Cast- Autographed Poster of entire cast and name listed in credits of DVD.

$50  KIDsanity! Water Bottle and Signed Poster Of Cast- KIDsanity! water bottle, autographed poster and your name listed in credits of DVD.

$75  KIDsanity! T-Shirt and Water Bottle- Receive a KIDsanity! t-shirt, water bottle, autographed poster and your name listed in credits of DVD.

$125  KIDSanity! DVD Download- Receive a digital download of the completed KIDsanity! DVD, an autographed poster and your name listed in credits of DVD.

$250  KIDsanity! Combo Pack- Receive a complete hard copy KIDsanity! DVD, water bottle, T-shirt, autographed poster and your name listed in credits of DVD.

$500  Put Your Kid In The KIDsanity! DVD- Sponsor a child age 6-12 to be in one of the workout DVDs. Receive a copy of KIDsanity! DVD and your name listed in credits of DVD.

$1,000  Attend A Filming- Your name listed as "Producer" on DVD credits. Have a child in one of the workout DVDs. Attend a live taping and receive a copy of KIDsanity! DVD.

$2,500  Appear In KIDsanity! Infomercial- 1% Ownership of entire project. Executive Producer Credit. Have a child in one of the workout DVDs. Attend a live taping. Appear in the infomercial. Receive a copy of KIDsanity! DVD.

$5,000  Own Part Of The Dream- 5% Ownership of entire project. Executive Producer Credit. Have a child in one of the workout DVDs. Attend a live taping. Appear in the infomercial.

There’s a giving level for everyone! Don’t miss your opportunity to be a part of this groundbreaking project that will change the lives of so many youth. We only have 30 DAYS to raise our goal of $15,000. We need your help now!


WHY THIS IS SO IMPORTANT

America is overweight. That’s just the bottom line. We can no longer watch our kids eat themselves to a slow death without giving them a fighting chance at health. Instead of teaching them how to be unhealthy and obese while they’re young, then expecting them to spend their entire adult lives fighting the bulge, why not teach them early better eating and fitness habits? This video isn’t about making kids skinny, but it’s about teaching them healthy alternatives for a more fulfilling life in a fun exciting way. Schools have removed Physical Education. Video games have replaced outdoor games like Freeze Tag. Kids are more sedentary now than ever.

There’s never been a fitness program targeted to youth done BY youth and KIDsanity! is changing that. The fun easy to do workout routines and the entertaining skits will work in tandem to increase kid’s awareness of how to take control of their health at an early age. The parents will also learn from a Pediatrician and Clinical Psychologist how they can make a more physically and mentally healthy home for their children. Until this point, fitness has been left up to people to figure out once they become adults and then they’re left buying every workout DVD or piece of exercise equipment they see advertised in an effort to reverse the decades of abuse they’ve done to their bodies. KIDsanity! is the preventative measure that will teach kids early what most of us wish someone would have taught us.


SO WHAT IF YOU CAN’T CONTRIBUTE FINANCIALLY?

While it would be perfect if everyone could donate at least $10, the reality is you just may not be in a position to donate at all. But you still can help! If you don’t have money, you definitely have a network, a group of friends, a circle of influence, something! If you see the value in this project then spread the word! Tell others about it and encourage them to donate.  Share this link with everyone you know and let’s get the donations flowing so that KIDsanity! can become a reality. Indiegogo has built in tools right on this page which make sharing this campaign a cinch! Simply click all of the links and share with entire social network. Time is of the essence. We want to release this DVD in time for Christmas so don’t delay. Donate and spread the word to your friends!

Thanks!

Ryan C. Greene

C.E.O. GreeneHouse Media

alternatives to what they’re currently being taught. I’ve incorporated the help
of my own two children and we are setting out to revolutionize children’s
health and fight childhood obesity one kid at a time!

THE PROBLEM

Childhood
Obesity is an EPIDEMIC in America. The Center for Disease Control and
Prevention’s states:
· 
Childhood obesity has more
than doubled in children and tripled in adolescents in the past 30 years.
· 
The percentage of children
aged 6–11 years in the United States who were obese increased from 7% in 1980
to nearly 18% in 2010. Similarly, the percentage of adolescents aged 12–19
years who were obese increased from 5% to 18% over the same period.
· 
In 2010, more than one
third of children and adolescents were overweight or obese.
Childhood obesity has both immediate and long term effects on health and well being. Some immediate health effects include: risk factors for cardiovascular
disease such as high cholesterol and high blood pressure, pre-diabetes and
greater risk for bone and joint problems, sleep apnea and social and
psychological problems such as stigmatization and poor self-esteem. Long term health effects include: likelihood to
be obese as adultsand are
therefore more at risk for adult health problems such as heart disease, type 2
diabetes, stroke, several types of cancer, and osteoarthritis.

WHAT WE’RE GONNA DO ABOUT IT
’s Coach
Greene’s KIDsanity!: In-Home Fitness Training System will only be the
BIGGEST, MOST EXCITING, MOST ENTERTAINING, MOST INNOVATIVE solution to fight
against childhood obesity this side of EVER!  A multi-disc DVD training system designed FOR
KIDS and LED BY KIDS; KIDsanity! is not about getting
skinny or becoming muscular, but this DVD system promotes physical fitness,
healthy eating and healthy living for kids in a fun exciting way. Kids who
embark on this 60-day fitness plan will get fit, learn better eating habits,
become more physically and mentally healthy and successfully combat childhood
obesity.
Your contribution to this
campaign will make the filming and release of Coach Greene’s KIDsanity! possible
thereby helping to combat childhood obesity and develop a healthier generation
of youth. Your donation to make Coach Greene’s KIDsanity! a reality will
literally SAVE CHILDREN from a lifetime of health, mental and financial
problems relating to obesity.




THE PROBLEM SOLVERS

GreeneHouse Media has been
providing “Media That Matters” since 2005. Founded and run by Ryan C. Greene
(that’s me), GreeneHouse started as a book publishing company and has published
15 book titles reaching over 30 Amazon Best Sellers Lists. GreeneHouse is now
transitioning into video and Coach Greene’s KIDSanity! is its
first offering. I am a professional speaker and media personality. I have
authored 5 self-help books, hosted national radio and TV shows and have a heart
for helping young people. I am the proud father of Jordan and Jayden and am
from Baltimore, MD.

GreeneHouse has assembled an All
Star Team of experts to help make this project a success!



Coach Kena Hodges: Certified Zumba Instructor- will lead the Dance
Workout workouts.




Coach Opel Jones: First Degree Black Belt, Karate- will lead the
Martial Arts Workout workouts.




Coach Jamaal Piper: Certified Physical Trainer- will lead the
Strength & Conditioning workouts.



Renee Carr, PhD.: Clinical Psychologist- will discuss with parents
the mental benefits of fighting obesity.




Maia Jackson, MD.: Licensed Pediatrician- will discuss with parents
the health benefits of fighting obesity.



Jordan & Jayden: The 11 and 9 year old brother and
sister workout leaders for each DVD.

WHAT WE NEED TO MAKE THIS HAPPEN



Every single dollar helps! No
contribution is too small. If you see value in this project, we urge you to
give as much as you can, as soon as you can- then spread the word and encourage
others to follow suit! We only have 30 DAYS to raise $15,000 to fully fund our
project. If you want to give, give today!
Our fundraising goal is $15,000. That money will cover: film
equipment rental, film crew, photography and catering for filming for five days
($7,500), editing and post-production ($1,000), trademark fees ($1,000), logo
design ($300), packaging design ($200), DVD pressing/packaging ($4,000),
rewards for funders ($400), print-marketing collateral ($200) and website
design ($400). If we surpass our goal of $15,000 all additional funds will go
towards: pressing more DVDs, recording radio promos, registering & travel
for trade shows, shooting a 2-minute infomercial. We chose to go with Indiegogo
because in the unfortunate circumstance that we do not reach our full goal we
still can use all donations! If we do not reach our full minimum goal of
$15,000 every dollar will be put into filming the actual workout DVDs.  

WHAT YOU GET FOR DONATING
Because your support is so valued, we have some great perks
as a “Thank you” for your support. 
$10  Thank You Video- Personalized
"thank you" video emailed to you.
$25  Signed Poster Of Cast- Autographed
Poster of entire cast and name listed in credits of DVD.
$50  KIDsanity! Water Bottle and Signed
Poster Of Cast- KIDsanity! water bottle, autographed poster and your name
listed in credits of DVD.
$75  KIDsanity! T-Shirt and Water Bottle-
Receive a KIDsanity! t-shirt, water bottle, autographed poster and your name
listed in credits of DVD.
$125  KIDSanity! DVD Download- Receive a
digital download of the completed KIDsanity! DVD, an autographed poster and
your name listed in credits of DVD.
$250  KIDsanity! Combo Pack- Receive a complete
hard copy KIDsanity! DVD, water bottle, T-shirt, autographed poster and your
name listed in credits of DVD.
$500  Put Your Kid In The KIDsanity! DVD- Sponsor
a child age 6-12 to be in one of the workout DVDs. Receive a copy of KIDsanity!
DVD and your name listed in credits of DVD.
$1,000  Attend A Filming- Your name listed as
"Producer" on DVD credits. Have a child in one of the workout DVDs.
Attend a live taping and receive a copy of KIDsanity! DVD.
$2,500  Appear In KIDsanity! Infomercial- 1%
Ownership of entire project. Executive Producer Credit. Have a child in one of
the workout DVDs. Attend a live taping. Appear in the infomercial. Receive a
copy of KIDsanity! DVD.
$5,000  Own Part Of The Dream- 5% Ownership of
entire project. Executive Producer Credit. Have a child in one of the workout
DVDs. Attend a live taping. Appear in the infomercial.
There’s a giving level for
everyone! Don’t miss your opportunity to be a part of this groundbreaking
project that will change the lives of so many youth. We only have 30 DAYS to
raise our goal of $15,000. We need your help now!

WHY THIS IS SO IMPORTANT
America is overweight. That’s
just the bottom line. We can no longer watch our kids eat themselves to a slow
death without giving them a fighting chance at health. Instead of teaching them
how to be unhealthy and obese while they’re young, then expecting them to spend
their entire adult lives fighting the bulge, why not teach them early better
eating and fitness habits? This video isn’t about making kids skinny, but it’s
about teaching them healthy alternatives for a more fulfilling life in a fun
exciting way. Schools have removed Physical Education. Video games have
replaced outdoor games like Freeze Tag. Kids are more sedentary now than ever. 
There’s never been a fitness
program targeted to youth done BY youth and KIDsanity! is changing that. The
fun easy to do workout routines and the entertaining skits will work in tandem
to increase kid’s awareness of how to take control of their health at an early
age. The parents will also learn from a Pediatrician and Clinical Psychologist
how they can make a more physically and mentally healthy home for their
children. Until this point, fitness has been left up to people to figure out
once they become adults and then they’re left buying every workout DVD or piece
of exercise equipment they see advertised in an effort to reverse the decades
of abuse they’ve done to their bodies. KIDsanity! is the preventative measure
that will teach kids early what most of us wish someone would have taught us. 

SO WHAT IF YOU CAN’T CONTRIBUTE FINANCIALLY?
While it would be perfect if
everyone could donate at least $10, the reality is you just may not be in a
position to donate at all. But you still can help! If you don’t have money, you
definitely have a network, a group of friends, a circle of influence,
something! If you see the value in this project then spread the word! Tell
others about it and encourage them to donate. 
Share this link with everyone you know and let’s get the donations
flowing so that KIDsanity! can become a reality. Indiegogo has built in tools
right on this page which make sharing this campaign a cinch! Simply click all
of the links and share with entire social network. Time is of the essence. We
want to release this DVD in time for Christmas so don’t delay. Donate and
spread the word to your friends! 
Thanks!

Ryan C. Greene
C.E.O. GreeneHouse Media

story:
We all have the potential to be superheros

I'm a premed student preparing to apply for medical school in the ever nearing future. I have an amazing opportunity to travel to Uganda this summer with a medical nonprofit organization called International Medical Outreach. This trip will allow us to provide healthcare and supplies to the local people. I have this vision of my future where I'm a doctor working in a third world country caring for those who face the diseases we forget still exist. I need your help to get my foot in the door. You're donations enable us to give vaccines to children and their families that may otherwise die. We all are puzzle pieces working together to better humanity. No matter how small a donation, know that it gets us one step closer.

Where your money goes

The money you graciously give will go to my plane ticket and basic needs while I'm over there in Uganda. Any extra money we raise will be donated to International Medical Outreach for future trips. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, no worries! But please help me to spread the word! 

 

If you're more interested in the organization I'm working with here is their website:

http://imoutreach.com/

story:
NEW: click here for more background on the story behind this campaign

Introduction

Got aches and pains?  Or are you ahead of the game and looking to prevent their onset?  Either way, you've come to the right place!

Welcome to the first book that thoroughly explains how the body develops, how it changes structure over time, and why it wears down – not primarily because of aging or genetics, but because of the movement habits we learn as we're growing up in (or adapting to) our modern environment – and, most importantly, how to fix it when things go wrong!

We don't just need to move more as a society, we need to move better.  We promote regeneration or degeneration in our muscles and joints every single day based on our unconscious movement habits, and the only way to combat and reverse the effects of bad habits is to learn better ones.

Unfortunately, this information is not yet coming from our medical professionals.  For starters, the effects of poor movement patterns often build up for years or decades before symptoms develop. But doctors, especially when constrained by our "medically necessary" insurance restrictions, rarely address these issues until AFTER patients are already in pain!

In addition, we focus on alleviating the pain or trying to strengthen the area that hurts, without seeing the big picture and fully addressing the root cause.  The resulting uphill battle has led most people to believe that so-called "normal" wear and tear is unavoidable and permanent, instead of something that's completely preventable and correctable!

(For example, did you know that cartilage regenerates?  It's just a matter of whether your habits wear it down faster than it can grow back!)

I want to bring this information to the public – teaching people how to understand their bodies and what to do to take care of them – in a highly illustrated and professionally polished format that will really open eyes and begin to change the way we practice medicine.

The Human Body User Manual

I’ve completed a detailed outline for "The Human Body User Manual: Physical Health" (updated estimate of around 300 pages), which is the first in its series (subsequent volumes will deal similarly with nutrition and mental health).  This book will teach people how the body actually works as a biological machine, in order to detect, prevent, and correct the majority of biomechanical dysfunction.

What can it solve?  Well, for example, in my case I've already:

  • corrected flat feet
  • eliminated foot, knee, and hip pain
  • restored range of motion in the ankle (that I didn't know I had lost)
  • regained the ability to stand on one leg at a time (essential to many daily actions)
  • gotten half an inch taller in the last year
  • increased my leg press strength by 90 pounds in 11 days
  • finally found the meaning of "engaging the core"
  • and even reduced ingrown toenails by changing how I walk and stand!


→

But that's just a small sample, from my own case!  Check out my table of contents:

Table of Contents

Preface
Introduction
Section 1:  Evolutionary Context

  • Chapter 1: Understanding the Body in the Context of Evolution
  • Chapter 2: The Running Man Theory
Section 2: How the Body Works (Anatomy & Physiology)
  • Chapter 3: Everything's Connected (Structural Tensegrity)
  • Chapter 4: The Dynamic Body and Brain
  • Chapter 5: The Road to Dysfunction
  • Chapter 6: Correcting Movement Patterns to Restore Health
Section 3: How the Body Works (Kinesiology)
  • Chapter 7: Foundations: Core and Peripheral Relationships
  • Chapter 8: Core Comprehension: A Better Definition of Core Strength
  • Chapter 9: The Lower Body: The Myth of Foot and Arch Dysfunction
  • Chapter 10: The Upper Body: Posture and Other Results of Core Weakness
  • Chapter 11: Use It or Lose It: Barefoot Running as the Ultimate Core Exercise
Section 4: Understanding Your Condition
  • Chapter 12: Arthritis, Osteoporosis, & Bone Spurs
  • Chapter 13: Poor Posture
  • Chapter 14: Neck & Shoulders
  • Chapter 15: Back Problems
  • Chapter 16: Hip Problems
  • Chapter 17: Knee Problems
  • Chapter 18: Foot & Ankle Problems
  • Chapter 19: Sports Injuries
Section 5: Treatment Approaches
  • Chapter 20: Purpose and Goals
  • Chapter 21: Steps to Preventative Health Care Approach
  • Chapter 22: Getting to Know Your Feet
  • Chapter 23: Self-evaluation
  • Chapter 24: Troubleshooting
  • Chapter 25: Postural Reeducation & Alignment Guides
  • Chapter 26: Walking & Running
  • Chapter 27: Strength Training Exercises
  • Chapter 28: Martial Arts, Yoga, & Other Movement Therapies
  • Chapter 29: Additional Maintenance & Rehabilitation
Appendix A: Bare Feet in the Modern World
Appendix B: Case Studies
References
Glossary
Index
About the Author

To get an even more detailed summary of the topics covered in this manual, take a look at my chapter-by-chapter overview.

Since this is my first book and it’s so important, I'm starting off by working with a professional writing coach.  I plan to use an independent publisher and release it first as an e-book this spring (the biggest time factor is how long it will take to produce illustrations for it after the writing is done).  I’d then like to use responses and feedback from the wider audience to generate a second edition, even better (and at no upgrade cost for anyone who’s purchased the first), in relatively short order (easily accomplished with the initial digital format).


Budgeting for Quality

I know people need this as soon as possible, and I want to get a first edition of it out this spring.  But on my own, I can't afford to develop it to the standard I would like to without it taking much, much longer than that!

To put it together, I've been working with a couple of fantastic folks, Lisa Akoury-Ross of SDP Publishing Solutions, and Jenna Lloyd, my writing coach and one of the assigned editors.  Quality is called for, if it's going to inspire the kind of change I hope for in our medical system.  I've come up with the following priority budget plan as follows.

The minimum that I believe would allow me to complete the first edition this spring is $8100, but still with significantly limited images, editing, and design.  On the other hand, to spend the amount of time I would really like to on this, without having to constrain images or skimp on editing and design (and make it easier to transition to print later), my ideal goal is $21,500.

MINIMUM (for spring publication):  $8100
BETTER (more editing & illustrations):  $15,000
BEST (ideal goal for best quality first edition):  $21,500

With less than the minimum goal, I will continue to forge ahead, but it will take a lot longer.  If we reach beyond my max goal, more choices open up, and I'll take a vote to see which direction you would most like me to go next (such as expanding content, offering print copy versions, or getting straight to work on the next volume in the series)!


Moving Forward, Together

Overall, I plan to find a way and go forward with this regardless of how much funding I receive, but your support in advance will make it a much less difficult endeavor, and will improve the quality and speed with which I can make it available to the public.

I believe that this is something that will significantly benefit the majority of human beings living in the modern world, by taking our body literacy and successful self-care to a new level and starting the ball rolling on a truly preventative and comprehensive approach to health care.  I hope it will make sense to you as an investment in your own health and the health of those you love, and you will join me in helping to change the world for the better!

Sincerely,

Stephanie

PS.  Monetary contributions are not the only way to make a difference!  If you have information, skills, or expertise you'd like to volunteer toward this project, I would also be grateful!  Additionally, if you know anyone else who may be interested in supporting this project, please share it!  Thanks so much for your time and support!  :)
