story:
I want to be perfectly transparent. I didn't need that much money. Somehow I added 20,000 and could not change it later.

Hello and welcome to my fundraising campaign to raise money for medical supplies. I feel somewhat guilty for asking for money because I know there are other people who are in far worse condition than I am.

My name is Jaime. On June 10, 1987 my life changed forever due to an unfortunate gunshot wound I received when I was 14 years old. Long story short, another kid was playing with a loaded handgun and it accidentally discharged striking me in the neck which left me paralyzed.

Because of this I became a C4-C5 quadriplegic. This means my spinal cord was severed between the fourth and fifth cervical vertebrae. I have very limited arm movement and no wrist nor hand movement. I pretty much need 24 hour care which would include bathing, getting dressed, and feeding of which my parents have done for the last 25 years.

My passion is computers and technology. I am the guy who all of the neighbors brings their computer to when they need help. I love helping out where I can up to the limitations of my disability. I spend most of my time on social network websites which allows me some outlet to meet other people. I rarely leave my house other than to attend an occasional movie or go out to eat with close friends. My father and mother have  taken for the last 25 years and have kept me very comfortable and healthy. Without them I have no idea what I would do.

The reason why I need this money is specifically for what is called a hoyer lift. This is a mechanical lift that uses a sling and a lift that is used to get me in and out of the bed into my wheelchair. Today, my mother and father use what I call for a lack of a better term the potato sack method. Basically physically lifting me in and out of my bed into my wheelchair. My parents are getting to the age where it is very difficult if not impossible to lift me in that matter anymore. The lift would go a long ways to helping us out. The rest of the donation would go to other medical supplies such as a manual wheelchair and other miscellaneous supplies.

As you are well aware medical supplies are very expensive and my insurance company only allows $1000 per year for durable medical supplies. In reality this means that they will not pay for anything and most of the expenses that I occur for durable medical supplies has come out of my pocket. The over the ceiling hoyer lift itself cost around $5000 installed. I use a mouse stick to type and those are $70. A manual wheelchair cost around $3000 due to the customization it would need for my severe disability. I do not take any government assistance such as SSI.

I know there are other people who are far worse than I am however, if you feel this is a worthy cause feel free to donate. Once again I would like to thank you for considering my campaign and your pending donation. Every little bit of money sure would help me a lot.

By the way, the picture on the campaign shows my mom, my good friend Corey, and me. The reason why they have their hands on my chest like that is because we went to the taste of Colorado and I spilled curry chicken on my T-shirt. They are covering the stains with their hands. God love them.

story:
Hello Everyone, 

 

Firstly Thanks a lot to all and every each of you for looking at our campaign.

 

My name is Inga and I currently live in Bradford,UK. I have an older sister Agne who lives in London. We also have two little half-sisters Uma 5yrs and Era 3yrs. Our parents divorced years ago and our Dad Juozas age 58 re-married. They live in Calgary, AB, Canada. Our Mum lives in Lithuania.

 

We are very close family and share everything together. Good things, bad things, sadness and happiness. When we were kids we used to spend all weekends together with family in nature. And now when we all around a world we speak to each other nearly every day. 

 

My dad is respected sports person in Lithuania. He is very active, very friendly and clever person. He is loving and caring Dad. He is our mountain. He always supports us no matter what. He is our best friend.

 

For the last few years our Dad was taking care of our little "Tornadoes". And spend all time with them. They lived in Canada before for a while, but then moved back to Lithuania after Uma got ill. She has a very bad asthma. They stayed in Lithuania for a while until Uma got better and, after realising that they have better opportunities in Canada, they packed their stuff and moved to Calgary in  August 2012.

 

Everything was going quite good, but Dad started to feel worse and worse pains in his left side of body. Like rib pain, but it started to get so much worse, so Dad decided to see doctors. Oh, I forgot to mention that first he started to feel these pains around March 2012.  

 

After millions of tests and scans, on the 10th of January 2013 our family was hit with horrible news. Our Dad was diagnosed with multiple myeloma. Which is bone marrow  cancer. Normal medication and chemotherapy won't cure the illness just slow it down. 

 

It was absolute shock to all of us. Our heads were full of questions... Why? Why him? What went wrong? He is healthy person, he doesn't smoke, he use alcohol only on special occasion, he eats loads of fruit and vegetable.. Why?

 

After few days of trying to understand what happened we decided that we have to return favour to our Dad and help him as much as we can. Days and nights me, Agne and me been living in internet, searching for solutions, advice, support. We found Dr Gonzalez in New York and at the time we thought it is very good place for him to go. It is very costly, but at this point we all understand that money is nothing to compare with life of our Dad.

 

Me and Agne decided to send letter to some close friends to help us raise money for him to g to New York. As per today we received nearly $2000 from people that are close to us. Also, very good friend of our family contacted us with another solution rather then Dr.Gonzalez. He advised us that at this stage is the best place for him is to go to Hippocrates Health Institute (HHI). And stay here for few weeks. We spent few days discussing this solution and we decided that we want him to go there. There he can help himself. Treatment is expensive, but it's nothing compared to the value of his life.

 

To do that we need to find help to support his wife with girls. So, we discussed it between us and we decided that the best option is for me to go there. It will let Dad relax and concentrate when knowing that his wife is not struggling and girls are looked after their sister.

 

So it looks like a plan.. We staying positive, Dad is waiting for me to come and let him go there, but we don't have enough funds. We need minimum $5000 for his treatment and tickets to Florida, and around $2000 for my trip and stay in Canada. Plus all other expenses. We already have $2000 from friends and I am already checking tickets for me and Dad.

 

We decided to make this campaign because we have no other choice. We need money and we need it fast! We need to help our Dad as soon as we can and we need to make him stronger and healthier. So your help and support is so much appreciated! We want to do this for our Dad, without him worrying about money. We want him to go there and take care of himself. And we will do the rest.

 

At the moment he doesn't work. He looks after girls and is using an ant-cancer diet that has been recommended to him during his own research... He is a strong person and we all believe that with a bit of our help he will be fine. By 'our' I mean YOU, me and all people around us.

 

 

So please, help us to help our Dad. 

 

If you have any questions, any advice please do not hesitate to contact me! I am here for that.

 

From all of our family Thank You!! We can all turn his life around and help him be healthy and happy person again.

 

 Inga

story:
Summary

Ninja Cleaner is a Windows application that's designed to remove temporary files from your computer. The program searches your entire hard drive for potential space-wasters, including files used by commonly-used programs such as web browsers and media applications. The goal of the program is to be able to clean as much as possible as easily as possible.

 

 

What Sets Ninja Cleaner Apart?

What makes Ninja Cleaner different from other temporary file removers? Ninja Cleaner aims to be user-friendly, as well as functional. It already contains options for cleaning web browers, along with several different temporary file types. To be developed are options to clean files left behind by specific programs (such as Dropbox, Spotify, and Adobe Reader), an "At A Glance" feature which shows how much space temporary files are using on your computer, and an option to quickly run the most basic cleaning job from your desktop. Also in the works are features which allow for media library organization and optimization. Also, God willing, Ninja Cleaner will come with support for plugins that third parties can write in order to extend its capabilities.

In addition to including features that other applications don't have, Ninja Cleaner uses open-source projects in its code base. As a result, the projects help Ninja Cleaner grow, and vice versa. Also, I am an independent developer who eventually wants to make a living from programming, either for myself or for other companies. Ninja Cleaner is written by one guy who simply wants to get his project out there.

Why I Need Money

While I've managed to work without much help and resources up to this point, I'm going to need both in order to make Ninja Cleaner a success. Here's a general idea of what I intend to use the money for:

  • Windows Licenses. This should be pretty self-explanatory.
  • Android Devices. I need Android tablets and/or phones in order to test the (hopefully) future Android version of Ninja Cleaner.
  • Advertising. I would like Ninja Cleaner to have as much exposure as possible, and that requires advertising.
  • Artwork. Advertising won't mean much if Ninja Cleaner doesn't have a proper mascot to represent it.
  • Translations. I'd like Ninja Cleaner to be as accessible to as many people as possible, and this means that it should be available in as many languages as possible.
  • Development Tools. I may have to buy another program or two to either add some details to this version of Ninja Cleaner, or to help me create other ones.
  • Unexpected Costs. They crop up. Life throws curveballs.

 

 

What You Get

No matter what you donate, you're getting your own copy of Ninja Cleaner a month before it's officially released to the public (God willing, of course)! $5 is the recommended donation, but any donation is fair game to get a copy. Also, your name will land in the credits as a special thank you to you!

If you donate $10 or more, you'll get access to an early version of Ninja Cleaner, starting on June 21st! This early (alpha) version will be very limited; only two cleaning jobs will be enabled, and the custom cleaning job will only clean a few web browsers (Internet Explorer, Firefox, and Chrome) and temporary file types. This is mainly so that I can gather feedback and suggestions, as well as so you can see how in-depth I intend to go with Ninja Cleaner. Also, if you send me feedback during the alpha and beta periods, your name will be placed in the credits as a tester.

A donation of $15 or more will grant you access to every plugin to be made for Ninja Cleaner from now until the end of the program's life. Plugin support most likely won't be available until around the full release. If you're a C# or VB.NET developer (or any other .NET developer), $25 will grant you access to the plugin SDK so that you can make your own plugins. A release date for the SDK is to be determined, but that will most likely also be near the time of the full release, God willing. Also, you'll get an extra alpha access link to give to a friend!

$50 will grant you all of the above, as well as free copies of Ninja Cleaner for all other platforms it's written for. Also, you will get to help decide what platform it gets written for first!

Finally, a donation of $100 or more will allow you to download copies of any other program that I officially develop and release, regardless of how much I normally sell it for. You get access to everything!

 

 

What's Next?

As the fundraiser goes on, I plan on coding core features for Ninja Cleaner so that it can be as fully-functional as possible as quickly as possible. The beta is set to be released several months after the alpha, and the final release shouldn't be too far after that. I can't give any specific dates, but I would like to have the full release finished before either the end of this year or early next year. After the Ninja Cleaner beta or full release, I plan on beginning a new port for Ninja Cleaner for a different platform. What platform? I don't know yet. God willing, I guess I'll have to keep you posted.

Besides working on Ninja Cleaner, I have some browser extensions that should be worked on, along with a small app for mobile devices and the web. Other than that... who knows? So many ideas, so little time.

Other Ways to Help

If you're unable to donate, there are other ways you can help with Ninja Cleaner. Here's just a few of the ways you can help:

  • Spread the Word. The more people that know about this fundraiser, the better.
  • Translate. I would like Ninja Cleaner to be available in many languages. If you have a fluent understanding in another language, please get a hold of me! We can work something out!
  • Code. I currently maintain two open-source projects on Codeplex, and they're both used in Ninja Cleaner. One of them is actually the base project for the plugin SDK as well, so they're quite essential to the life of Ninja Cleaner. You can take a look at them here.

And, of course, if you've donated and have access to the alpha, there are some additional things you can do to help:

  • Offer Feedback. I can't stress this enough: I need to know what you think of Ninja Cleaner, as well as what works and what doesn't. Follow the link in Ninja Cleaner in order to tell me your thoughts!
  • Write Documentation. My development time is focused on programming. While I could write a help file for Ninja Cleaner, I would also appreciate someone's collaborative help with writing it.

 

Thank you very much for checking out this fundraiser; I appreciate it! If you have any questions or comments, feel free to leave them either here or in this thread!

Development Tools. I may have to buy another program or two to either add some details to this version of Ninja Cleaner, or to help me create other ones.

Unexpected Costs. They crop up. Life throws curveballs.
 

 
What You Get
No matter what you donate, you're getting your own copy of Ninja Cleaner a month before it's officially released to the public (God willing, of course)! $5 is the recommended donation, but any donation is fair game to get a copy. Also, your name will land in the credits as a special thank you to you!
If you donate $10 or more, you'll get access to an early version of Ninja Cleaner, starting on June 21st! This early (alpha) version will be very limited; only two cleaning jobs will be enabled, and the custom cleaning job will only clean a few web browsers (Internet Explorer, Firefox, and Chrome) and temporary file types. This is mainly so that I can gather feedback and suggestions, as well as so you can see how in-depth I intend to go with Ninja Cleaner. Also, if you send me feedback during the alpha and beta periods, your name will be placed in the credits as a tester.
A donation of $15 or more will grant you access to every plugin to be made for Ninja Cleaner from now until the end of the program's life. Plugin support most likely won't be available until around the full release. If you're a C# or VB.NET developer (or any other .NET developer), $25 will grant you access to the plugin SDK so that you can make your own plugins. A release date for the SDK is to be determined, but that will most likely also be near the time of the full release, God willing. Also, you'll get an extra alpha access link to give to a friend!
$50 will grant you all of the above, as well as free copies of Ninja Cleaner for all other platforms it's written for. Also, you will get to help decide what platform it gets written for first!
Finally, a donation of $100 or more will allow you to download copies of any other program that I officially develop and release, regardless of how much I normally sell it for. You get access to everything!
 

 
What's Next?
As the fundraiser goes on, I plan on coding core features for Ninja Cleaner so that it can be as fully-functional as possible as quickly as possible. The beta is set to be released several months after the alpha, and the final release shouldn't be too far after that. I can't give any specific dates, but I would like to have the full release finished before either the end of this year or early next year. After the Ninja Cleaner beta or full release, I plan on beginning a new port for Ninja Cleaner for a different platform. What platform? I don't know yet. God willing, I guess I'll have to keep you posted.
Besides working on Ninja Cleaner, I have some browser extensions that should be worked on, along with a small app for mobile devices and the web. Other than that... who knows? So many ideas, so little time.
Other Ways to Help
If you're unable to donate, there are other ways you can help with Ninja Cleaner. Here's just a few of the ways you can help:


Spread the Word. The more people that know about this fundraiser, the better.

Translate. I would like Ninja Cleaner to be available in many languages. If you have a fluent understanding in another language, please get a hold of me! We can work something out!

Code. I currently maintain two open-source projects on Codeplex, and they're both used in Ninja Cleaner. One of them is actually the base project for the plugin SDK as well, so they're quite essential to the life of Ninja Cleaner. You can take a look at them here.
And, of course, if you've donated and have access to the alpha, there are some additional things you can do to help:


Offer Feedback. I can't stress this enough: I need to know what you think of Ninja Cleaner, as well as what works and what doesn't. Follow the link in Ninja Cleaner in order to tell me your thoughts!

Write Documentation. My development time is focused on programming. While I could write a help file for Ninja Cleaner, I would also appreciate someone's collaborative help with writing it.
 
Thank you very much for checking out this fundraiser; I appreciate it! If you have any questions or comments, feel free to leave them either here or in this thread!

story:
Greg's Story

Greg Dixon is a hardy soul. He hunts moose every year to provide for his family and shares with others. He also fishes each summer. In fact, it is not unusual for him to leave Fairbanks on a Friday after work, drive 320 miles to Chitina, unpack his dipnet and some Pilot Bread (TM), and fish from the rocky riverside. He'll stay for a day or two to catch some of those beautiful Alaskan Copper River red salmon, then return to Fairbanks for work or more play. Or it's back to work at the  gold mine.

Greg works at a gold mine somewhere north of the Glenn Highway, in one of those mountain valleys none of us have ever seen, and probably never will. Greg and several people live there throughout the summer, hoping to leave a little richer, and maybe even a little wiser.

When he's gone during the summer, Greg leaves wife Sasha, born and raised in Fairbanks, and three children, ages five, eight, and ten. The kids have been schooled at home and their playground is the great outdoors. Sasha and Greg and their friends teach their children by teaching them their surroundings. They plant and grow a garden and greenhouse organically. The kids run barefoot everywhere. They need a bath in the summer all the time, but forget it, they will be dirty again in an hour.

Imagine the horrifying news in December when they found out that Greg had cancer of the colon. Later, they learned the cancer had metastasized to the liver, making it necessary to postpone surgery.

Why We Are Fundraising 

Between November when Greg first saw a doctor in Fairbanks, Alaska and January when Greg began receiving chemotherapy treatment in Katy, TX, Greg and Sasha had accumulated over $50,000 in medical bills. Greg is seeing an oncologist in private practice who was trained at the renowned MD Anderson. This reduces the bills by not having the high overhead associated with MD Anderson. They have also received some assistance from pharmaceutical companies who are willing to provide medication at a discount. Some of Greg's treatment costs are now being covered by private medical insurance, but some are not. The cost of the hospital stays, oncologist, chemotherapy, and upcoming surgeries (at least two) are accumulating at a staggering rate.  

The Dixon Family 

Greg grew up on Cordes Way in Goldstream Valley and went to West Valley High School. His father, Larry Dixon, moved his family to Fairbanks from Florida, where he had worked at Cape Canaveral. Unfortunately, Larry passed away in December, soon after Greg learned he had cancer, and before Greg could return to Anchor Point to see him again. Greg's mother Fran continues to live in Anchor Point where she is an avid quilter. Greg has three sisters: Carla, Paula, and Lynette. Lynette has temporarily re-located to Texas to help Sasha and Greg by looking after their children while her own children are at home.  

Other Ways You Can Help

We know some people want to help but are unable to give any financial assistance. You can still help by sharing Greg's story and by keeping Greg and Sasha and their family in your prayers. 

Thank you!

story:
Do you want to Sponsor a Speculum? Fund a Forceps? Nourish a Newborn Exam? Patronize a PAP? Donate for a Doppler? or Monetize a Microscope?

Now is your chance!

As you may well know starting your own small business requires a lot of time, energy, and funding. An out of hospital midwifery practice also requires a lot of equipment. 

I would love for you to help me build my business, stock my "Birth Bag", and equip my office. 

Please consider donating to help me purchase the items I need to provide quality care to families in Snoqualmie Valley and beyond. If you would like your donation to go to a particular item please indicate that in your note.

 Check out the Perks for a chance to name a speculum and other great opportunities!

I'm on my way....

I have completed my Masters degree in Nursing with a specialty in Midwifery, passed my national certification exam, and am in the process of becoming licensed as an Advanced Registered Nurse Practitioner through Washington State. 

After over 10 years of education, finishing my Bachelors degree, working as a labor and delivery nurse, and making my way through Graduate school I have finally realized my dream of becoming a Certified Nurse-Midwife. 

I am so grateful for all the love and support I have received! I couldn't have made it this far without my family, friends, and colleagues. 

Now I am in the process of creating and opening my midwifery practice, Three Moons Midwifery PLLC and hope you will help create this needed service with me.

I will provide holistic, evidence-based, individualized, full scope midwifery services to adolescents through elders, including primary care of those with female reproductive organs,  gynecology, family planning, pregnancy/labor/birth/postpartum, and newborn care.  My pregnant clients will be able to choose home or birth center birth based on their desires for their experience.

Check out the developing website www.ThreeMoonsMidwifery.com

Examples of items needed and approximate prices:

Disposable gloves ~$10 per box

Sterile gloves ~$30 per box

Drape sheets ~$20 per box

Sutures ~$30 per box

Needle holders ~$50 per

Forceps ~$25 per

Medical basin ~ $15 per

Graves Speculums  ~ $40 per

Pederson Speculums ~ $40 per

Oxygen masks ~$30 per

Retractors ~$100

Exam light ~ $100

Pulse oximeter ~$400

Digital thermometer ~$250

Doppler~ $600

Microscope ~ $500

Microscope supplies ~ $100

Resuscitation bags ~ $250

Autoclave ~$2,500

and much, much more!

Thank you so much for your consideration.

story:
Help Raise Funds For Daniel St.Marie's Medical Expenses

In the early hours on Sunday the 19th Daniel St.Marie was the victim of a hit and run. He is currently receiving medical treatment at Umass Memorial in Worcester, Ma. With the way medical bills stack up nowadays, we want to make this recovery as simple and as speedy as possible. So lets show the St.Marie family some support and help with some of Danny's medical expenses!

Any and all donation will be directly helping Danny and his family with his medical bills, including funds that exceed the goal limit.

If you are unable to donate, or do not have the means, please help the cause and share this fundraiser with your friends, relatives, and anyone you can think of!

Danny is such a strong willed person, and along with your prayers and support, he will bounce back like the string bean he is!  
  
His family and friends do appreciate all support,so if you would like to send your love and light please do... you can find him here--  Daniel St.Marie

story:
“Last winter, my wife and 8 year old daughter traveled to Spain for the holidays. Our trip was going great until one day we were sitting in the Piazza and we heard a shout. We looked over and saw a dad beating up on his crying child. In that moment of witnessing the sadness and terror on his son’s face, my first thought was “I need to write a check to Hand in Hand tomorrow. Every parent needs an alternative to that.”

A generous and anonymous donor was so moved by the way that Parenting by Connection transformed his relationship with his daughter, and believes so strongly that parents around the world need tools besides punishment and time outs that he presented us with a fundraising challenge. When you give, your tax-deductible donation will be matched dollar for dollar up to $15,000.

There are parents in East Oakland who know nothing else besides threats and spanking. There are moms in homeless shelters in Boston who know nothing else besides yelling.There are adoptive dads who have no idea how to connect with their despondent children. As Zelon Harrison, a Certified Instructor puts it:

“Just growing Parenting by Connection over East Oakland, and then into other cities and communities, is a must because children are continuously being abused and neglected. And it’s not because their parents don’t love them. It’s because their parents don’t feel supported. And their parents don’t feel that they have the tools (which Hand in Hand offers) to do this hard work.”

Zelon and other instructors ready and willing to help. They are ready to wade into the trenches of the parenting communities who need the most support. They are ready to hear the most extreme cases of parents abusing and neglecting their children. Why?

Because they believe the Parenting by Connection tools can change the lives of these families for the better. Sadly, it’s the communities where parents need support the most that can afford it the least. That’s where you come in.

A $50 donation will get over 25 booklets into the hands of parents who need help with specific topics like setting limits, tantrums, and healing their children's fears.


A $150 donation will give 10 parents access to intensive support classes.

And a $500 donation will allow Certified Instructors to offer in-person support classes to teen moms, and new parents in poor communities who can't afford classes on their own.

“Never believe that a few caring people can’t change the world. For, indeed, that’s all who ever have.”-Margaret Mead

We invite you to make your donation right now, and be among that special group of caring people who are, indeed, changing the world.

Share Hand in Hand's $15,000 matching campaign with parents you know who feel passionate about children growing up in loving homes: http://igg.me/at/handinhand15kchallenge

To learn more about Hand in Hand Parenting, please visit: http://www.handinhandparenting.org/

story:
Late in November 2011, I underwent a nine and a half hour surgery to remove my thyroid gland and a sizeable tumor from the side of my neck - thyroid cancer had metastasized into my lymph nodes. It had been growing slowly for years. With 3 small kids, my own care always fell to the bottom of my to-do list.

Surgical healing took many months and was eased by the incredible support of our friends and family. Restoring endocrinological balance - which is required to 'feel well' - is a goal not yet reached. Those close to me know that it has been 15 months of intense chronic pain and fatigue, while managing the kids and my business. As my husband and I are both self-employed since his layoff 2 1/2 years ago, medical fees and the demands and limitations of recovery have ravaged us financially. We have been driven to work hard to turn our finances toward 'the black' - I only took 3 weeks off work right after the surgery - yet my perpetually compromised health has been painting a bleak future outlook for sometime now. I have only been able to cope, not heal.

I am getting the allopathic medicines correct after a long fight and bad luck (or medical negligence - however you want to frame it), and working to get the nutritional supplements fine tuned to support the replacement meds. I'm just a wee bit up from bottom and hopefully headed in the right direction. Yet the physical experience of the last 15 months has left me with little hope that my body can fully eliminate the cancer already in me not to mention fight off anything else coming down the pipeline.

Panchakarma ("PK") is an intensive healing program offered by traditional Indian medicine, Aruyveda. It is a month-long process led by an Aruyvedic doctor which includes thorough cleansing and deep restoration through numerous treatments, Aruyvedic medicines, and medicinal foods. There are many stories of malignant tumors shrinking dramatically after treatment, as well as general deep healing and transformation. I have no doubt that this treatment would be the turnaround my body and life have been needing, but had given up on being able to do. I have a lot I need to be healthy for: my kids, a career in mid-ascent, loads of bills to pay, and helping others.

The cost of flights and treatment amount to $5000. The doctor has already allowed me to produce photos in exchange for the cost of my accomodations at the center. Perhaps just a little bit from a lot of people could help make this happen for me.

story:
A VERY BIG THANKS TO EVERYONE WHO HAS CONTRIBUTED.

 

Hello, You've reached the Fundraising page for

The Dorset Destroyers.

Dorset's 1st Wheelchair Rugby Club

We are a THESE ABILITIES Sports Club, not Disabilities 

http://thedorsetdestroyers.weebly.com/media-articles.html

Having been able bodied many years ago, and slowly getting more and more disabled every year, it made me realise that I really have to take life by the balls and do it.
So, we are currently fundraising like mad, while we have some Taster Sessions running to see if it was just Paul and I who wanted to play or if there really was demand.
Our 1st Taster Session bought in 5 players, which we were quite impressed by. The 2nd one bought in 11 players, and the 3rd one we are expecting 13!!
So, we've got the players in place, we have a Venue, funding for 1 and a half Wheelchairs, but we know need to get another 15, as the final taster has 15 players attending.
Each Wheelchair costs £2,600 as it's built to protect the player when being hit. (Hit seems like such a tame word, when you have a 15 stone ex Soldier bearing down on you in a Wheelchair, because you have the ball)
In total we need to be able to raise another £39,000 to be able to play, that's without the cost of the Hall hire, the balls, hoists to help players getting in and out of the Chairs.
So, we don't stop at £2,600 we just keep going and going. It will happen, and in years to come our aim is to have players playing in the Paralympics.
The thing about Wheelchair Rugby/Killerball/Murderball (Call it what you will) is that it really does prove that Disabled People are just as competitive as our able bodied compatriots.
Our Club is based around the ethos of a Rugby Club, we play, supporters come along to watch, we meet after for a drink, chat, bit of fun and we go out for Socials, whether to a Pub/Quiz Night or a BBQ.
Everyone who plays and supports this Club takes it personally and shares the same ideas and passion that the players do.
It's not only a great way to exercise, but a great way to change people's lives. 
We've had people crying and saying it's changed their sons life.
Confidence levels are boosted way beyond what anyone of us was expecting.
The beaming smiles tell it all. Wheelchair Rugby is more than just a game, it's a route back in for some people, a way to remind people that they are more than just a disabled person sitting in a Wheelchair.
We are not a Disability Sports Club.
WE ARE A THIS ABILITY SPORTS CLUB

The beaming smiles tell it all. Wheelchair Rugby is more than just a game, it's a route back in for some people, a way to remind people that they are more than just a disabled person sitting in a Wheelchair.
We are not a Disability Sports Club.WE ARE A THIS ABILITY SPORTS CLUB

story:
This page was setup by Paul's close friends and family when we realized he was too modest to ask for help. He's the type of guy that will never burden anyone else with his problems, but in this case, he needed us and we were happy to rise up for the occasion. We created this fundraising effort in order to assist Paul with his medical expenses during this difficult time so that he can focus his efforts on his health and overcoming the disease.

We've all heard this story before, but the road to recovery is a long one and it hasn't even reached its halfway point for Paul. The whole process is expected to take an entire year from his life. That's a year that could have been better spent working on more films like The Avengers, Planet of the Apes, and Looper! An entire year he could have spent bettering the lives of others and putting his friends before himself-- something he STILL does despite his condition. Paul has been there for so many of us and now its time to help him and show how much we appreciate everything he does.

On November 22, 2013 Paul's life changed forever. A mother's intuition inspired a search for answers when she noticed an irregularity on her son's facial appearance. What began as a brief holiday visit back to Houston, quickly turned into days and weeks of doctor visits. Suspicion of infection along the right side of his inner cheek lead to multiple tests searching for answers. All the while he and his family hoped for a simple solution but had to act fast without insurance or aid from his employer because he works as a freelance artist. 

Finally, on December 13th there was an answer, but not one we had anticipated. His doctors discovered that Paul had a rare form of cancer called Rhabdomyosarcoma. It's a fast growing cancer that requires immediate and intense treatment. Overnight Paul was forced to give up his passion and career in film, and immediately disconnect from his life in Los Angeles to move back with his family in Houston, Texas.

Thousands of dollars had been spent getting to this point, and having no insurance made deciding what to do next very difficult. After viewing his limited options, it seemed their best was to enroll in a county-based health care system called the Harris Health System. Fortunately the process was expedited and allowed him to get to the health care he desperately needed. Having healthcare options on their side has given them hope for the future, but much of the damage has already been done. 

Paul and his family are still monetarily accountable for both his past and future tests, doctor visits, and long hospital stays, not to mention standard living expenses as well. Our goal is $10,000, but we hope to raise much more as his medical treatment expenses continue. Any level of support is greatly appreciated, and we truly thank you for taking interest in Paul's story.


A message from Paul:
It wasn't till about December 13th that I had an idea of what I was up against.

I have cancer; its called Rhabdomyosarcoma. It developed on the right side of my face and grew quickly once we noticed it. There's a lot to figure out still and some things may remain unanswered indefinitely; it all depends on the actions and information that are still to come.

The life I had before in California is behind me right now and for the foreseeable future and though I can't begin to figure out every step ahead of me, I know I'll do my best to be strong, and trust in God to get me there. 

It's been difficult to understand the boundaries of relationships- who will show up or how to ask for an afternoon spent watching a marathon of movies, Skype chats, gaming together, or whatever. I've been so fortunate to be supported by many friends, and family already. I don't take those efforts or contributions for granted. Its been relieving just to see or hear from people during all this. 

This doesn't come with a manual or step by step guide; this has been a chaotic experience, and I don't have all the answers, which is aggravating-- I like a schedule and stability. I just want you to know that you don't have to have the right words or answers either. We can figure this out one step at a time and if you want to be a part of my struggle, then I welcome you.

A HUGE thanks to all of you who shared or helped contribute to Paul's effort!!!

story:
Short Summary

Help sharpen the image of one of the most visible locations in town!

The Jimmy C. Draughn Aquatic Center in Valdese, North Carolina is a jewel of a facility. Renovated and named in 1999, the pool has seen use from people all over western North Carolina and the Unifour area. Over the years thousands have enjoyed it for cooling down in the summer or learning to swim any time of year. Five separate teams now call the Rec home: Valdese Torpedo (summer), XCell Aquatics (USA Swimming), Burke Stingrays (Special Olympics), Jimmy C. Draughn High School, and East Burke High School.

Now the center needs your help: After all of the years of swim lessons, swim meets, and birthday parties, the lane lines at the Rec are worn out. As a way to keep the pool functional and to meet the demands of the community in an effective way, it needs new lane lines.

What We Need & What You Get

Here's what we need, and, in return for your help, what you get:

  • The funds will go to the purchase of 12 brand new 75-foot lane lines made by Kiefer and a storage reel for them to live on when out of the pool. These are some of the best lane lines on the market, and they will make an instant impact on the appearance of the pool. 
  • The new lane lines will be in the town colors: red, white, and green.
  • Based on the amount you donate, you will receive exciting gifts showing your support for the Aquatic Center! Wristbands, t-shirts (Adult S-XL), towels, framed photos, and acknowledgement of your generosity in heat sheets are our way of saying thank you to our donors!

The Impact

Every year, the Jimmy C. Draughn Aquatic Center hosts all sorts of events, and the new lane lines will be recognized by visitors from all over:

  • Children in swim lessons, and the parents who bring them
  • Community members who enjoy lap swimming as a way to stay fit
  • Aquacise classes
  • The annual Valdese Sprint Triathalon
  • Summer swim meets held by the Valdese Torpedo Swim Team
  • High school swim meets hosted by Wildcat and Cavalier Swimming, including the Rudolph Relays and the Cavalier Last Chance Meet
  • The Stingray Invitational meet for Special Olympics teams
  • Swimmers escaping the heat during the summer months
  • Divers coming to earn their Scuba certification through Scuba Adventures of Rutherford College
Your support in helping the Jimmy C. Draughn Aquatic Center won't go unnoticed!

Other Ways You Can Help

We know all of you would like to help with donations, but support doesn't stop there:

  • Spread the word on social media! Send links to friends, family, or anyone who you know has had great times at the Rec in order to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Tell people at church and at work!
  • Tell people at the pool when you come to visit!
  • Send in your pictures of you or your family enjoying the Rec for us to post with our campaign!
  • Don't forget to try out the Indiegogo share tools!

With your help and support, we can meet our goal and show visitors to Valdese just how much we love our Rec and the Jimmy C. Draughn Aquatic Center in particular!

story:
Free Flow Academy has been serving Placer County for the past 4 years as the original and only Parkour Gym in the area.  From our humble beginnings we have grown to be a small Parkour studio, to the largest and most diversified Parkour Gym on the West Coast.  Our community is incredibly supportive and ACTIVE!  We want to add more value to our community by building the most epic Ninja Warrior Training Course on the West Side!  OR if the community would rather just see a massive Gym Upgrade (which we seriously need!) then we'll do that!  Either way, the funds will be used to better the gym and training facility for the community.  


OUR PLAN:  We have been quoted anywhere from $10,000 - $200,000 on a Ninja Course.  What you see in the main photo is a $200,000 set up, and we plan on building a humble or elite course depending on the commitment of the community. If we raise a few thousand dollars, we'll put in a few Ninja Warrior obstacles such as a salmon ladder and things like that.  

- Install 2-6 Tiers of Ninja Course (the more tiers we have, the more obstacles)

- Flooring installed which will need to be completely padded with resi mats throughout

- Obstacles installed - The most popular requests so far have been 1) Salmon Ladder 2) 14' warped wall 3) Cliff Hanger 4) Angled Rock Wall

- Purchase Soft Vaults for beginner level vaulters


Construction will begin June 2016 and we hope to be complete by August 2016!

WHAT WE WILL USE THE MONEY FOR:  

The money we receive from this campaign will be used to buy materials and labor.  This is what we will need to buy:

  • Obstacle Course Tiers and Professional Installation
  • Flooring/Mats/Resi Pads
  • General Supply/Materials (Bars, Pipes, Wood, Hardware) for Obstacles
  • Custom Materials for Obstacles (Holds, Anchors, Harnesses)
  • Soft Vaults
  • Paint for all the new stuff

If we do not reach the full amount for this campaign, we will use the donated funds to do as much of this as we can.  We will start with the most functional parts of the project.

WHY YOU SHOULD DONATE:  With your donation, you are helping to create an awesome facility that serves an amazing community.  We are offering some amazing perks for donating that will give you tons of great deals!  AND limited edition/VIP stuff.  You get all the perks a first in line kind of deal would get.  If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help us out!  Thank you so much for your donations!  Every dollar counts.

  • Help us share our campaign around the internet!  The more you share, the more people can help!

story:
Summary

 

Hello I am Don, for the past 17 years I have been a Personal Trainer in New York City working on Training & Nutrition For Clients in New York, on the morning of March 23rd I was going to the Gym to meet with a Client when I slipped & fell on the Ice hitting my Arm on the Concrete. My Wrist was Dislocated then Reset & X Rays showed a Fracture on my Ulna Bone on the Left Arm. Over the Past Month we have tried to Heal the Arm Without Surgery but it is needed to get my Arm to Heal completely.

My Insurance will Pay for a Percentage of the Medical Bills & some of the Physical Therapy but I will not be able to work for an estimated 4 Months more and the Medical Bills are adding up. My Personal Expenses are being covered by my Boyfriend Tom's Salary but our savings have been Depleted by all these Medical Bills and every Day there are more Bills in the Mail.

Any and all donations will be directly helping Me with the Medical Bills, including funds that exceed the goal limit.

If you are unable to donate or do not have the means, please help the cause and share this fundraiser with your friends, relatives, and anyone you can think of!

Thank You for taking the time to Read My Story, You Have My Best Regards ! 

  

The Impact

With this Surgery and Physical Therapy I will be able to go back to Work as a Personal Trainer, at the age of 46 I am Humbled by this Injury and the Reality of just how Fragile we all are.

 

Risks & Challenges

The Surgery will involve attaching a Plate to the Broken Ulna Bone to help the Arm to Heal Completely, once I have the Surgery I will need Physical Therapy to Improve my Left Arms Mobility & Help with the Circulation. After the Bone Heals the Plate will be Removed but the Timeframe is open to allow for proper Recovery.

I also will do Daily Therapy in my home to Help with all My Physical Therapists Work. My Background as a Personal Trainer has shown me how Important the Therapy Work is to give me the Best Possible Outcome.

Other Ways You Can Help

 Please Share My Campaign with your Friends and Family !

story:
Hello everyone! I currently have saline breast implants and they will be 7 years old this October. I can see and feel that it is time to re do them, just wear and tear from normal every day life.  I am at cam model at myfreecams and its important to me to feel and look the best i can. I have decided to get silicone this time because of all the added benefits. They cost a little more but its worth it. I'm a 32G bra size now and I love my breasts!! I don't want to get the smaller or bigger, I basically just went to switch out my old salines for a new set of silicone (same size). 

I appreciate all donations and plan on giving gifts to everyone who donate. I would also like to show my appreciation to the person who donates the highest amount by taking them on a date.  If you can come to NC or NJ then I would gladly take you out, on me of course! This can take place before or after my new boobs, you can decide. Thank you all!!

story:
Location: To Be Determined

Short Summary

This Winter the Movement Laboratory and Warnky Warriors will be opening Columbus's 1st Parkour and Ninja Warrior facility!

Although this endeavor has already received funding from multiple sources, this campaign will help with that little bit extra to help outfit the facility with safe and challenging obstacles. It is our vision to create a facility that will be home to people of all ages and skill level. 

Michelle Warnky (Founder of Warnky Warriors) was chosen to lead this project because she shares the Movement Lab's  passion for family and fitness. She has spent years sacrificing her time and money to build an amazing family oriented community in Columbus . The Movement Laboratory is proud to help this passionate individual in her journey and we hope that you will join us! 


The Facility  

This campaign will help outfit the facility with safe and challenging obstacles. These obstacles have inherent risks but through years of experience we have developed progressive teaching methods and identified the necessary equipment to mitigate these risks. 

All we need is the money to help us create the ideal safe facility with the following obstacles and many more!

  • Warp Wall
  • Trampoline
  • Foam Pit
  • Quad Steps
  • Salmon Ladder
  • Cliff Hangar 
  • Spring Floor
*The exact location is still to be determined. We will update this campaign as soon as we lock in a facility. 

Perks

This campaign is designed with the intent of rewarding our early supporters. Perks are your way to receive discounted memberships, privates, and parties! 
The more you donate the more you will save. If you are interested in joining the facility once we open now is the time to act! 

Movement Laboratory 

Founded in 2010 the current Movement Laboratory is located in Hainesport, NJ. Over the past five years we have developed a community that inspires  members of all ages and skill level. Our current facility is one of the largest in the country and is home to more American Ninja Warrior Finalist than any other facility in the country. 

From weekly adult competitions to  children's birthday parties and special needs classes the Lab offers something for everyone! 

We plan on bringing the same quality, offerings, and mentality to Ohio. To learn more about the current Lab visit our website.


Michelle and the Warnky Warriors 

Warnky Warriors is an Ohio based fitness organization founded by Michelle Warnky, one of the only women to beat the Ninja Warrior Qualifying Course. Warnky Warriors currently offers private training sessions and hosts one of the Largest Ninja Warrior Events in the country! 

Warnky Warriors is now ready to take that next step in fostering their community. A space of their own would give this community a home in which they can build a safe training environment. 

If you are interested in learning more about their community and what they have accomplished visit WarnkyWarriors.com


Other Ways You Can Help

If you support our mission please share this campaign with your friends via any social media outlet (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc. )

If you would like to donate your time and services to help us build out the space please contact Michelle directly:

Michelle Warnky | 614-517-8853 | email-warnkywarriors@gmail.com

story:
Who is UBC Quidditch?

Well we are two teams based in Vancouver Canada, who are USQ Official, and we are having a little trouble flying across the country to get to World Cup

Our Story

UBC Quidditch was founded a little more than five years ago with the hopes and dreams of getting ourselves to world cup. Ever since it's beginning we, as a team, have been striving to show what we are made of. This year with more than 60 recruits we have begun the training necessary to take 42 of our finest players to the top. The World Cup hosts some of the finest players and teams in our sport and getting the chance to attend this event will allow the world to see what we're really made of. 

Where the Money will go

Well as you already know, we are a Canadian team that is looking to travel across not only 1 but 2 countries and well girl this is not cheap. So all the money that we will raise from the page will go towards flying our players on something a little faster then our brooms. 

What will you get

Are you curious to see what the merch looks like? Well here it is. You've got your Sunnies, Bro Tank, Moose Hoops, and UBC Sweater below!

Sunnies 

Bro Tank 

Moose Hoops

UBC Sweater 


Other ways you can help 

As you already know, we need all the help we can get. If you know anyone that is interested in helping some quidkids out send this to them. You can send it to you mom, dad, grandparents, dog, neighbour, cats, that one random kid in your class, your lover....really anyone who can help. 

We'd just like to say thank you for even just looking at the page because it matters. Thank you so much for your support and we hope to see you either on or off pitch, or at World Cup 8 

If you have any other questions send an email to ubcquidditch@gmail.com or a facebook message here!

story:
Hi,

my name is Barbara and I am 32 years old. I have massive fatoedema on both arms and legs. This disease is only remove able through a liposuction which is not paid by the health insurance coverage.

 

After the birth of my little daughter the illness is raised so much that I have over 40kg more in both arms and legs. I have massive pain and walking is very difficult and painful for me. 

 

I could not pay the money for the liposuctions, because they are to much and the costs are to high for me allone.

 

So i need YOUR help to get well soon.

 

If you want further information’s about me and my Story please look at Facebook for Babses Lipo and add me as a friend J

 

Please help me and share this with your friends and spend a little bit of money – every cent is helpful.

 

THANK YOU SO MUCH <3

 
 
 
 
Hallo Zusammen,
 
mein Name ist Barbara bin 32 Jahre alt und ich habe ein massives Lipödem an beiden Armen und Beinen. Diese Krankheit kann man leider nur durch eine Liposuktion bekämpfen welche aber nicht von der Krankenkasse bezahlt wird.
 
Nach der Geburt meiner Tochter ist es so schlimm geworden, dass ich innerhalb von kurzer Zeit 40kg schwerer wurde. Ich kann nun kaum laufen und habe sehr starke Schmerzen.
 
Die Kosten für die Liposuktionen kann ich alleine leider nicht aufbringen, da es mehrere Operationen sind und ich nicht genug Geld alleine zusammensparen kann.
 
Ihr würdet mir sehr helfen ein bisschen mehr Lebensgefühl zu bekommen.
 
Mein Hintergrund:
 
Ich leide seit Anfang der Pubertät an etwas dickeren Beinen. Immer wurde mir gesagt, dass ich Diät und Sport machen soll. Es wurde immer schlimmer aber nichts hat geholfen. Seit der Geburt meiner Tochter ist die Krankheit explodiert. Ich habe 3ocm Umfang an den Beinen zugenommen (pro Seite!) und bin nun insgesamt 40 kg schwerer als vorher. Alles nur an Armen und Beinen und ohne eine Chance auf natürlichem Weg das ganze wieder los zu werden.
 
Ich habe seit 2008 3 mal in der Woche 2 Stunden lang Lymphdrainage, quäle mich in Kompressionsstrümpfe und lege mich in einen Kompressionsautomaten für zuhause und sehr starke Schmerzen bei jeder Bewegung. Wirklich helfen tut das aber leider nicht.
 
Der einzige Ausweg ist ein Operationsmarathon wo das ganze kranke Gewebe mit Hilfe der sogenannten Liposuktion abgesaugt wird.
 
Aufgrund der schwere der Erkrankung sind insgesamt 6 Operationen nötig.
 
Wenn diese nicht erfolgen Ende ich im Rollstuhl, kann mich nicht mehr bewegen und muss dem Schicksal ins Auge sehen sogenannte Elefantenbeine zu bekommen. Dies ist das Endstadium der Krankheit und ich habe da wahnsinnige Angst vor.
 
Eine Operation kann das aufhalten!!!!
 
Genauere Infos gibt es auf Facebook. Sucht einfach nach Babses Lipo und addet mich :)
 
Jeder Spender darf dort gerne sich verlinken und den weiteren Werdegang mitverfolgen.
 
Ich Stelle dort Hintergrundinfos online und werde Berichten wie es weiter geht.
 
Als Anreiz mir zu helfen habe ich mir folgendes ausgedacht.
 
25 € - Ein Vorher Nachher Bild von mir im Original per Post mit einem persönlichen Gruss
 
75 € - Ein von mir gebackener Kuchen / Torte
 
150 € - Ein Kalender mit Bergpanorama - Aufnahmen mit persönlicher Widmung von mir (Bilder alle von mir selbst geschossen)
 
250 € - Ein von mir handgemaltes Bild mit einem Motiv Eurer Wahl (abstraktes kann ich am Besten)
 
500 € - Einladung zu einem 3 Gänge Menue - bei mir und meiner Familie von mir gekocht für 2 Personen.
 
Wenn das erzielte Geld nicht komplett für alle Liposuktionen reichen sollte, so ist wenigstens schon ein Anfang gemacht und ich kann evtl 1 oder 2 Liposuktionen davon bezahlen.
 
Desweiteren sind Kuraufenthalte, Lymphdrainagen und die Bekleidung in Übergröße auch immer sehr teuer.
 
Egal wieviel - jeder Cent hilft mir wahnsinnig weiter.


Wenn Ihr nichts geben könnt, leitet bitte meinen Beitrag weiter - teilt und macht bekannt.


Das würde mich sehr sehr glücklich machen.

 

DANKE FÜR EURE HILFE!!!!! <3

story:
Flexr works just like any other pullup bar, with one big difference: once you finish your workout, it folds up to a 2 ft by 1 ft by 6 inch form that's compact and easy to store.

 

Traditional pullup bars are bulky, difficult to store, and impossible to travel with. It's a bulky contraption that people handle with difficulty. It's something people have tolerated for too long - no more!

Hi - My name's Derek, I'm the co-founder of the Flexr pullup bar. I had two main problems with traditional pullup bars:

1) There's nowhere to store them. They just take up so much space.

2) They're impossible to travel with. Every time I went traveling, I had to break my workout routine. 

Where do you put a pullup bar? Most of the time it looked like this - somewhere out of place:

That's why I decided to create the Flexr, the world's first foldable pullup bar.

Keeping up a consistent workout routine is difficult enough. It's even harder when you have to stop and restart your workout routine. Every time you break your routine, it makes it much more difficult to get things started again. Most people have to break their routine when they go traveling.

That's why I wanted to have a pullup bar that I could carry with me no matter where I went. Having a pullup bar that you can take with you anywhere you go makes it easy to keep up your routine - whether you're at home or in Africa.

 

The Flexr is a major upgrade over most other pullup bars - even if you're not traveling. Why?

Most pullup bars are so bulky that there's no practical place to put them. With Flexr, you can easily slip it under your bed or in a spare drawer. It goes from a "where do I put this thing?" to an afterthought. 

 

So, how do you actually use the Flexr? 

It's easy: just latch the pullup bar into your doorway. The sturdy top side lays on top of the door, while the door grips go on the other side. 

Then you're ready to get started with your workout!

 

 

 

You're ambitious and adventurous. You want to enjoy life to the fullest and experience all that the world has to offer.

But you can’t do it unless you are taking care of your body and working out.

You can only work hard and play hard when you’ve got an abundance of energy and vitality from eating health and working out. 

Using a pull-up bar is a great way to improve your workout. The problem is, common products on the market are ugly, hard to store and can’t easily be traveled with. 

Most pull up bars force you to sacrifice your apartment space, and don’t travel well. 

You shouldn’t need to make sacrifices when it comes to working out. 

So, as product designers with over 10 years of experience, who have used dozens of pull-up bars in the past 15 years of our lives, we made something better.

Flexr is made of three light yet durable materials:

  • The top door rest is made of injection molded plastic. That's the same stuff that iPhone cases are made from.
  • The bars themselves are made from bent steel. The same type of steel used in steam ships.
  • The center latch is made from aircraft-grade aluminum. 

The entire pullup bar only weighs 6 pounds. You can slip it in your luggage, without tipping over those pesky airline weight limits.

 

 

 

Meet Derek & Eric, the founders of Flexr.

Derek and Eric have built many product businesses in the past, both on their own and as business partners.

Derek: Derek’s built a t-shirt company and a supplements company in the past. He’s intimately familiar with how to get products manufactured and shipped to customers.

He’s also traveled 28 countries, gotten chased by a bull while motorbiking India, and got bit by a monkey in Indonesia.

Eric: Eric used to manage digital marketing for one of the largest beer companies in the world. Before that he spent three years building the eCommerce systems for one of the worlds largest CPG companies. Since then, he’s started several eCommerce businesses of his own.

Eric has lived in the United States, Brazil, London, Bali, Thailand and has traveled to over 20 countries.

 

 

  

 

 

   

 

 

 

Yes, we ship to frequent travelers. 

Digital nomad living in Chiang Mai, Barcelona or Costa Rica? We got you covered. 

We can ship your pullup bar anywhere in the world, and only ask for your address as we're about to ship it. That way, even if you're not sure where you'll be by the time we're ready to ship, you'll still be able to get your Flexr.

If you're unsure where you'll be when you receive the Flexr, just select U.S. shipping for now. You'll pay the difference in shipping costs once we're actually shipping the product.

We're projecting a ship date of January 2018. Just in time for New Year's resolutions!

 

Credit: Hubud & Outpost for letting us film in their co-working spaces in Bali.

 

Risks and challenges

Nobody wants to wait longer than necessary for a product they're excited about. We've worked very hard to get this product as close to fulfillment as possible, before going to Kickstarter. That said, here are the risks we see moving forward:

MANUFACTURING: Because the Flexr uses similar parts to other fitness products, most of it can be manufactured fairly easily. However, the folding top bracket and the weight bearing bottom clip are injection molded plastic and casted aluminum. Creating the tooling and castings for these two parts generally takes about 30 days, and this is where delays can happen. We're working with manufacturers with a history of prompt delivery to minimize that possibility.

PRODUCT CHANGES: As the Flexr gets closer to final production, there will likely be some minor improvements made to the final product. These will always be made with the end user in mind. Any changes we make will be communicated to you prior to receiving the product, and we'll always let you know exactly why and how the product was changed.

FULFILLMENT:

Our team has experience shipping products to thousands of customers in over a dozen different countries. That said, unforseen circumstances can occur that can cause delays in shipping. To reduce that risk, we've identified specific logistics providers we want to work with, and have already began the process of setting up shipping with them.

Video:

Claims in the video are not finalized and may change through the manufacturing process.

Any pledge amount brings us one step closer to our goal. Help flex your influencer muscles and help make Flexr a reality. Hit the pledge button to get started. THANK YOU for your support!

Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Questions about this project? Check out the FAQ

story:
Who Are We?

 

The Light Outreach charity aims to alleviate poverty and relieve the distress of the homeless. We offer homeless and disadvantaged people the opportunity to fulfil their potential and move towards an independent and optimistic future. We help children in street circumstances to realise their rights and their potential. Their potential is our inspiration and we aim to guide them in leaving the streets, by offering them stable living conditions, health care, education and training.

 

The Light Outreach street workers go out onto the streets of Tema and Accra on a weekly basis meeting children,  in their current environment, communicating with them and providing them with food. From this introduction, the street workers are able to befriend the children and introduce TLO house of refuge to them.

 

The Light Outreach was renting a property for about 30 street children and orphans. The lease ended earlier this year and the landlord advised us the lease will not be renewed as it wasn’t profitable.

This left 30 children between the ages of 1 - 21 potentially homeless. We were forced to move all the children under our care into an unfinished building. The building is the Shekinah Home we were building but have been unable to complete due to the lack of funds and unforeseen circumstances. At this present time the building is unsecure and can be hazardous, consequently it is important we raise £15,000 to complete the building of Shekinah home, subsequently the children who are currently housed and new comers can have a safe environment to live in. 

 

What We want to Do?

 

Our current plan is to build a children's home in the Greater Accra Region, Tema, called “Shekinah Children’s Home”. The home will house 50 orphans and street children. Currently there is an estimate of 33,000 children living on the streets in Ghana. The children’s home will provide a safe environment where street children can be housed and educated. In order to complete the building of Shekinah Children’s Home in Tema, The Light Outreach needs to raise a further £15,000.

 

10 young adults from the UK have come together and said they will participate in an exhilarating 13,000 ft  charity sky dive to help raise the money needed to build Shekinah's  children's home. So if we succesfly meet our target  on August 31st  the 10 young addults  will perform a 13,000 ft tandum skydive with UK Parachuting all in the sipport of  building the 'Shekinah Children's Home' in Tema, Ghana. The home will house and care for upto 50 orphans and homeless children in great need. So please help us to reach our targtet.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Dr. Anke Wanger, I am both a physician and a theologian, and have lived in Ethiopia for over 7 years. During this time, I have worked closely with a little known monastery there, which mainly serves as a home for elderly monks and nuns in the town of Lalibela. Currently, there are about 20 people living in it, with only one young nun to take care of them all.

What We Need & What You Get

The current situation is as follows: rainy season (Keremt) is starting, and there is absolutely no food left in the monastery. It has little comfort one way or the other (it was only this year that we even managed to install electricity), but know food resources are depleted, and replenishing is made  difficult, if not impossible, during rainy season. The young nun physically takes care of the elderlies, tries to organize food, and also works as much as she can to raise a tiny amount of money for basic necessities such as soap or washing powder.
The US$500 we are trying to raise will cover the food stuffs needed for the three and a half months of rainy season for the entire group of elderly.

Naturally, we will not be able to offer you much as "perks" (see below), except for the knowledge that you are helping the poorest of the poor, we will keep you updated with pictures and financial reports, and, if you wish so, we will forward your name that these monks and nuns may pray for you.

The Impact

I have been working with this monastery for a few years now, it is an integral part of Lalibela, an otherwise famous tourist destination, and we work hard on integrating the elderly into the town life. Due to the fact that few people even know about this institution, there is little support, both financial and otherwise.
Personally, I have experience with such projects; for example, in co-operation with locals, I helped to fundraise and build a home for elderly monks and nuns in Debre Tsige, a town around 90 km outside Ethiopia's capital, Addis Abeba.

This campaign is just intended to ensure food during the rainy season for the elderly; once rainy season ends, we intend to work on another income streams.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you yourself can currently not give, we understand. We just ask to share it with as many people as possible; every dollar, every euro helps.

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt: Short SummaryMy name is Dr. Anke Wanger, I am both a physician and a theologian, and have lived in Ethiopia for over 7 years. During this time, I have worked closely with a little known monastery there, which mainly serves as a home for elderly monks and nuns in the town of Lalibela. Currently, there are about 20 people living in it, with only one young nun to take care of them all.What We Need & What You GetThe current situation is as follows: rainy season (Keremt) is starting, and there is absolutely no food left in the monastery. It has little comfort one way or the other (it was only this year that we even managed to install electricity), but know food resources are depleted, and replenishing is made  difficult, if not impossible, during rainy season. The young nun physically takes care of the elderlies, tries to organize food, and also works as much as she can to raise a tiny amount of money for basic necessities such as soap or washing powder.The US$500 we are trying to raise will cover the food stuffs needed for the three and a half months of rainy season for the entire group of elderly.Naturally, we will not be able to offer you much as "perks" (see below), except for the knowledge that you are helping the poorest of the poor, we will keep you updated with pictures and financial reports, and, if you wish so, we will forward your name that these monks and nuns may pray for you.The ImpactI have been working with this monastery for a few years now, it is an integral part of Lalibela, an otherwise famous tourist destination, and we work hard on integrating the elderly into the town life. Due to the fact that few people even know about this institution, there is little support, both financial and otherwise.Personally, I have experience with such projects; for example, in co-operation with locals, I helped to fundraise and build a home for elderly monks and nuns in Debre Tsige, a town around 90 km outside Ethiopia's capital, Addis Abeba.This campaign is just intended to ensure food during the rainy season for the elderly; once rainy season ends, we intend to work on another income streams.Other Ways You Can HelpIf you yourself can currently not give, we understand. We just ask to share it with as many people as possible; every dollar, every euro helps.And that's all there is to it.

story: Hi All! Many of you know I serve on the board of Students Active For Ending Rape (SAFER), which is a national college sexual assault prevention organization. Every year I set a goal of raising $500 for SAFER during the month of April, which is also Sexual Assault ACTIVISM Month. Please consider donating $5, $10, $25 or however much you feel you can give to my campaign. All donations are appreciated and will solicit lots of love, hugs and high-fives from me!

story:
Brittney and Colleen have worked with parents and kids in their unique professions for over 7 years. Colleen has trained 100's of women on their motherhood journey in addition to training professionals around the world on Pregnancy & Postpartum Strength training. Brittney is a mom of 2 and has experienced first hand the need for families to have more support and family-friendly spaces.

Currently, the opportunity to be part of an educational, non-judgemental, public space and community as new parents and families is hard to come by! We're lacking the "village" and it's having a devastating impact on parent's mental and emotional health. Right now, 1 in 5 moms and 1 in 10 dads suffer Perinatal Anxiety and this directly impacts their abilities to parent. This is NOT okay. Brittney and Colleen are taking a stand to create the physical, mental, emotional, and spiritual space that is needed for families to thrive.

CO/CREATE is "a place for the community to connect" and our core values are Education, Non-Judgement, Transparency, and Creativity.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Raising $50,000 and above will allow us to meet the high demand of creating a beautiful, functional, inspiring San Diego location! Projected open date: October - November 2019.

 

Funds will be used for, but not limited to:

- Build out of location: cafe bar and coffee brewing equipment, interior design, and materials.

- Custom child play area with sensory boards, foam tumbling objects, cubby storage, and parent's bar height seating along perimeter.

- Functional, fun, open movement space with rubber flooring, kettlebells, battling ropes, custom bar cage. This space will be available for rent, workshops, presentations, and more!

- Fingerprint sign-in system for ease and utmost safety for the entire family.

- Security cameras

 

What you get! 

Unique Perks

$40        CO/CREATE Sticker + 10 Free Kid Play Drop ins ($100 value)

$100      3 Personal Training Sessions ($225 value) + 3 Child Watch Sessions ($45 value)

$250      Free Coffee for a year (1/visit) ($550 value) + 10% donated to Scholarship fund

$500      CO/CREATE 5 panel Hat + 1 year $75/mo Membership ($930 value) + 5% donated to scholarship fund

$1000    10 Personal Training Sessions ($750 value) + free coffee for year ($550 value) + 2% donated to scholarship fund

$5000    Hat, Membership for a year, Free coffee for a year, 10 personal training sessions, $100 donated to scholarship fund, and name on our “Founding Members” board in Cafe!

$10,000 (Product/Company Partnership)  3 stories and 2 posts (within 6 months of contribution) featuring your product, business, and/or name + logo/link in campaign newsletters + partnership shared in media interviews.

Not that we believe this will happen, but even if we do not meet our fundraising goal, all contributions will go towards opening this first location. Every dollar goes towards making our dreams of supporting our community a reality! 

 

The Impact

CO/CREATE addresses the enormous gaps in pregnancy, postpartum, family, and kid specific health through specific movement classes for each stage of parenthood and childhood development, healing play, free classes, support groups, creativity enhancement, stress-reduction, a variety of educational talks, and numerous empowering experiences. This is a ONE STOP SHOP for parents, with ample parking!

We designed this space to bring all the best together for our procreating community to grow; delicious food & drink, thoughtfully designed kid-friendly interior, comprehensive support groups and classes, and healthful movement for all. Pregnant couples, moms, dads, care-givers, professionals, coaches, medical providers...our doors are open to all who need a space to share their passion or re-charge.

 

Risks & Challenges

One of our core values is authenticity. In full transparency, we are extremely confident that you, our community, is going to stand behind us to make this fantastic concept a reality. We need your help because we know finances are the biggest hurdle for any new business. The risk of going into big debt to open our doors is stressful and every contribution made allows the burden to lighten and be more equally shared across many instead of a few. It’s a beautiful mirror of WHY we’re opening this space, WE NEED EACH OTHER. We are restricted if we try and go alone. We go farther, together. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We recognize that many people aren’t able to contribute and we appreciate you reading this far! Since you’ve made it this far, please help us by making waves with us by sharing this campaign with your peeps!

- Emails introducing us to your friends/clients

- Introduce us to people you think could support/join us

- Share on your social media accounts a few times

- Interview us for your podcast

- Host us on your video/instagram channel

 

What does your support mean to us?

We want your support because our hearts & souls are going into this space to be FOR YOU, for OUR community. We want our community to be involved as MUCH as possible!

Words will never do justice the immense humbleness and gratitude we feel for you investing your hard earned money into a space for all. It takes a high level of coming together to make big great things happen and you’re part of the movement. Please get to our space so we can give you a giant hug!

story:
The Neti Pot:

The Neti Pot is used to naturally cleanse, refresh, and protect the nasal passages. It’s recommended today by doctors and pharmacists worldwide.

It helps:

  • Remove excess mucus due to congestion

  • Rid nostrils of pollen and other allergens

  • Cleanse the nasal membranes of dust, smoke, or other airborne contaminants

  • Relieve nasal dryness due to air travel

  • Improve flow of breath before doing relaxation or meditation techniques

It was featured on the Dr. Oz show, described as Best of the Best Alternative solutions in the Allergy category;

see the link below.

http://www.doctoroz.com/dr-oz-ultimate-alternative-health-remedies

The Intelligent Neti pot:

The Intelligent Neti pot was designed for convenience and safety.  It heats water (use distill or sterile water) to near body temperature to ensure warmth and comfort solution for nasal irrigation. No more heating water on a stove top or microwave.

We also designed the Neti pot to be made of traditional ceramic without any harmful plastics or other materials that may leach into the water. 

Main features include:

  • Made of ceramic to avoid harmful materials

  • Does not corrode

  • Uses no plastics or metal that could leach into the water

  • Heats distilled or sterile water within 4-5 minutes to near body temperature

  • It then keeps the water perfectly warm

  • Energy saving mechanism


Developing the Intelligent Neti Pot:



Funding Our Project:

We hope that you can fund our project. A functioning prototype has already been completed and tested. However, your support will help us test and certify the product through an organization such as Underwriter's Laboratory (UL).  It will also help us during the production and distribution phases.

We appreciate your support!

By backing this project, you are helping make this new project become a reality. As an added bonus, any backer who shares this project will receive one free travel case with a pledge of $35 or more! So please share this project via social media, email and word of mouth to tell your friends and family about our campaign. Thank you in advance!

Risks and Challenges

We believe that everything is ready to go, however, there is always the possibility for manufacture problems, delivery delay…etc.

Having said that, we are confident that we are on track to deliver the first batch of our intelligent Neti pot in April 2016.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it’s going. Be transparent and specific—people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.
